sc91a4tJKKESuN3WF4bcGQ.text: Such a fan of this place. i wish my nephews were here so I could take them -- they would love it. Its a great place for kids. I wish they served breakfast or brunch. I ordered the Cobb Salad and it wasnt the best Ive ever had and probably will not order it again.  It was an entertaining lunch with the apes making noises, the fish in the tank over looking our table, the elephants and other active animals. Love. Four stars because the mall of america in MN location rotates so guests can see all of the animals. I know, I know... tough crowd.

QTr8R8x-F8II__10t7ePzg.text: Not sure why I returned here to eat....oh yeah - the kids wanted to go.   Over priced theme restaurant with slow service (the place is 85% empty) and bad food.  Never again!

3I-RGpTnjbmTCrMt9R8HnA.text: I'm usually not this harsh and can typically find something to like about a place but our experience was just not good. First, there was a huge line. I guess this is typical and I almost wonder if it's some ploy to make the place look more busy than it is.   Anyways, we get seated finally and we're in the corner. A round table and with no view of pretty much anything. Kids could hear the elephants but didn't get to see squat. To make it worse, the stupid table wasn't positioned well so basically, we had to wedge it against the other end of the simi-circle to even get in.   App were okay but the spinach artichoke dip was so overcooked it was nearly hard.  Got the main food and disappointing doesn't even cover my dish. Blacken tilapia w/ mango salsa. The salsa was so bland and did nothing for the poor tasting fish. Shrimp and scallops in cheese sauce. So if you're like me, maybe you're expecting a white cheese. Nope. American. Like Velveeta. Over the tiniest shrimp and scallops I've ever seen. Only saving grace was the coconut shrimp. They actually tasted good. Oh and the mashed potatoes but if you can mess those up, you deserved to be flogged.  Now at this point I think, whatever. Maybe I just got the wrong meal. Granted it was a $24 mistake but I'm not making that mistake with the desert. I get the volcano. Brownie, whipped cream, vanilla ice cream, and fudge/caramel sauce. No, just no. The signature dish that's freaking everywhere is just bad. I can honestly say, it would have been better if the bought box mix and made it up.   So all of this doesn't really warrant the one star but this is one of those meals that keeps on giving, if you catch my drift. The hour spent in the bathroom was the final straw.   My suggestion, go when it's not busy if the kids just have to go. Order the cheapest thing on the menu and split it. Then go to the food court and get something else. You'll be safer that way.

HK606eSRO-8IClnSbCM9ug.text: For a chain restaurant the food was unexpectedly good.  Enough for use to think about coming back.  The drinks were very light and the service was slow.   If it wasn't for the food it would have been a 2 star.

zfl_AEp9wyvPjNxvAT5KQQ.text: The server was good but the fish are Gone in the tanks and it's sad !!!! They also don't have the coconut Deseret anymore and the nachos are decent but that's all I recommend . Enjoy the alcohol cuz it's good !!

I6tDuuCJLXnTqYiDFrosQw.text: I was waiting for 30 minutes to see if someone is gonna come to ask if I want a drink or something and unfortunately, nobody came. I feel discriminated because I was by myself and they think that I cannot afford their food. Bad experience for a first timer. Poor service.

XCzy2_kOkJ9_GrIL-Q6p2g.text: This place is nice and the food is good. When the rainforest animals go off, that's awesome. I think they should add some misters so people will get "rained on" lol

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is some of the awesome food that my husband and I got! Yum!!

mJiWSiNCpawfi4kfnOpvsA.text: We came with my kids, husband, and my parents for lunch one Friday.  The decor is fun and does give you the feel of being in a rainforest. However the sounds and thunder/lightening are soooo loud. My 2 year old was terrified and still talks about the "scary restaurant ". Lol I ordered the paella. It was delicious, though the rice seemed a bit greasy. Everyone in the party was happy with their food. But it's the prices that get me. It's so overpriced for what you get.  I probably won't ever come back to the "scary restaurant " again. I came, I saw, I was not terribly impressed.

lZqWkh3l1J0FrCwUyVY3uA.text: This place is a very unique and awesome place where you can see animatronic animals.its quite amazing and the people there are very friendly.the only thing holding me back from giving five stars is because the food wasn't very good.

VG1t5O6PMRPebaEiDGOLpw.text: No gluten free menu & a little overpriced... My friends son loved the environment. The food took a very long time around the end of lunch time...  Besides that, the server was pleasant. Food was good. Had the chicken sandwich and it was kind of dry

4M4LEKuV2VJqV0B0tKCn_A.text: I have been to the Rainforest Cafe when they first opened and went back two days ago since my daughter was visiting from out of town. We knew it wouldn't be reasonably priced but what a sticker shock! $66.00 for three people and no appetizers! The place has seen better days. Yes, it was noisy with the "rain" and the "animals". The fish tanks looked nice though. I eat meatless and had the veggie burger with onion rings, my other half had a cheeseburger and fries, my daughter had "rasta pasta". The Rasta she said had a funny oil film on it, and my daughter thought it was part of the sauce so she mixed it in. She said it tasted funny and kind of rancid. My burger was ok but was a bit mushy. The cheeseburger was average. It was all over priced but the bonus from it all is that we all got sick from our meal there! :(   I had a "sour stomach" (read between the lines) until this afternoon and hubby also. I was the worst of us. My daughter had an upset stomach but didn't get what  we were reeling with.. geez! As for waiting for water and drink refills we had the same problem as others had at this location. I was very disappointed and of course we will NEVER be back again. What a shame. If you go, beware!  It was suggested to me when I first did this review to contact customer relations , which I did,and have yet to hear back from anyone there.  Sad.

puo_iZVIZS87ucbl6-kc6Q.text: Worst service ever and we didn't even get a chance to sit. There was a line out the door and when we asked if they were short staffed because there were so many empty tables the hostesses (4 of them who were standing around doing nothing) basically told us they'll seat us when the server in the rotation is ready and if we didn't like the wait we could leave. Really??? Don't waste your time and money on mediocre food and lousy service!

oxYUOUguN2MVgcmkWDNm7A.text: My mother and I came here with my two sons on a Thursday around 4:30pm there was only two other tables occupied when we came in. Our waitress was really nice but she sat us at a table that had a puddle of water under one of the seats. She took ours orders about 4:45 and we didn't get our food till 5:30. I got the fried shrimp. There were about 5 little soggy shrimp on French fries and an ounce of coleslaw(more like a little bowl of cabbage almost no sauce). My son got two sad hotdogs two pieces of dried orange slices and mushy watermelon. My mom got a taco salad and the beef wasn't seasoned at all. A total of $54.65 plus the $8 tip we left. Then we went to use the restroom and it was DISGUSTING! I needed to change my youngest on the changing table and it was filthy! I wiped it off with a wipe and it came up almost black with dirt! I had to lay paper towels down because they were out of  protectors. The toilet was nasty! And the floors were just awful!! It looked like a nasty unattended gas station bathroom!! For the money your paying the bathroom should be clean.. I'm assuming the manager and another employee were standing around talking and didn't even acknowledge us. It was a horrible experience.

ShUSRoR2CQK4uL7nYOFRpg.text: 1.) When I go to a restaurant with a friend and our two children I do not like to be confronted at our table by a man with a handwritten cardboard sign and a box of candy bars. The gentleman never spoke and roamed the restaurant approaching at least 8 or 9 tables. He had a drink at a table along with an awful lot of supplies.   I had noticed him before he approached the table because he was an adult male eating alone in what is a restaurant for basically children.  2.) Why does it take over an hour to get 2 burgers and 2  children's meals when there are only 11 tables occupied?  3.) They took 2 of the silver ware off the table. When the 2 children's meals came, they didn't bring any napkins for the kids. I asked for some and was told they would bring them.  We never received them.   4.) Costly food. Mediocre service. I guess you are paying for the ambiance but to me, it's so loud and needs a deep cleaning.

e9imQ-0L6UTU6Su2yerXtw.text: One star for the ambience, food is horrible,service is so slow, too pricey for the food

vYzdD9aZFKcgF27jSj4XQg.text: It is overpriced? Yes. Does the service lack? Yes, well a little, but the food here is pretty good and is a great place for kids.  Think of this place like a zoo experience for children.  While I know most adults do not care, kids do and that's why I liked this place.  The burger I got was pretty good and even came with some pretty tasty fries.  Overall, it's a great place to take the kids, just be prepared to spend.

0UzVqAq-xDAQd2SiEtabTQ.text: Horrible. Service was slow. Then we were told that the kitchen was behind after already waiting 25 minutes for our food. It was 5:00 when we ordered and the restaurant was half full. I would hate to see what the wait is when they had a packed house. Food came after 35 minutes of waiting and was okay. Kids meal was about the only good meal. Chicken/Shrimp combo with steamed broccoli. Nacho were way over done and chicken fried steak was just average.   The place was pretty dirty as well. Teach in bathroom over flowing.   Very disappointing. I know these pleases are not here for there food. But should be this bad.

b88RA_TVJd6taaSKPZ6W7w.text: We usually come here after going to SeaLife in the mall and it makes for a really nice lunch.  We like the food, the service is good....we have never been disappointed.  The atmosphere is the best and also very relaxing.  We like it a lot, not sure we'd go just for that alone, but so long as we go to SeaLife this is our preferred place to eat there.

FCgbbcsXYraJwgod1WlrRQ.text: My niece wanted to take her children here for lunch today, approximately 1215- wait in a short line, many many open tables. Our turn hostess said we now have to wait 10minutes more unless we are are Landry (?) my niece was, that sat us immediately. Waitress came took orders and drinks said its 10 min wait but she put our food in first. Place is half empty still! 60 minutes later our food comes out, fries cold, burger barely warm. I told the manager about fries he did bring new ones out-Not one word of an apology for the wait!  Food not that great,service is horrible I still tipped. Just won't be back.

JR1Iq0BgLye6Mpp22bLrqQ.text: UPDATE//Looked at there health inspections and while they are given an A/B rating they consistently have problems with the cooler not being at optimum temperature. It needs to be at 41 or less and most of the time its 45 and up resulting in food not being properly cooled down. That's gross! Health inspector made the manager throw out food that was taking too long to cool. In one report the manager got the cooler to 41 at the end of the inspection. Meaning they purposely keep it higher to save money. At the risk of bad food! Also most of the food is precooked and simply reheated before you eat it. Almost nothing is fresh. Burgers are pre-made meat mixtures that are cooked on a flat top, not an open flame. Pasta is cooked twice a week and portioned into bags. Multiple issues with the proper sanitation not being used. Things are not properly cleaned and sanitized. I'm not sure if they checked this ever again but the dish washer didn't reach 160 until the 3rd run on one report. This place is just barely scraping by. They either need to close or be forced to change.   I hadn't been here since I was younger. Went with my mom and boyfriend. We waited in the line for 10 min. Wasn't super long and the place was full. We were seated and a few mins later our server came by and asked what we wanted to drink. Very soon after we had our drinks and he took our order. Everything was going great. Then it hit rock bottom.  Server only came by to refill our drinks, once, in a half and hour. Utterly ridiculous. He told us our food would be out soon. Another 10 mins went by. No food. So in total 45 mins and there was no food, people that came in AFTER us got their food and left. Place was almost empty there's no reason for that. We left money on the table for our drinks. There was a bunch of staff members at the front just talking and slacking off. W told one of the girls and she was more concerned with the money we left than the fact we had to leave because we got no food. Honestly that was the last straw.  No point in calling anybody about it because they clearly don't care. I don't want a free meal that I have to wait an hour for. Please please stay away from here.

NkXMcgvtrpq7FgMUfW6-Og.text: Um. Not so much. If you like a kitschy atmosphere and overpriced food that's not so great than maybe this place is for you.  I suppose it's worth visiting at least once just to see the decor, but if you want a quality meal....yeah. No.  I had the Cobb salad which was not a wedge of lettuce, but mixed greens with iceberg. The bacon was bacon bits. I don't recall blue cheese so the amount was minuscule. There was about a whole bottle of balsamic on it.  The egg was crumbled. Anyway, kids would probably like the place....I will say the service was good.

w3VVyFtpGIQ_xHbrHcZuWg.text: I liked this place, the food was ok, alcoholic beverages were big & tasty! The atmosphere is loud because it's a very kid friendly place. I think it is a cool concept for a restaurant but it could be done better        I will probably be going back now that my hubby & I have a toddler I'm sure he will love it.   Overall, if you take the kids & have a drink or two you'll have a great time!

oTZV7Kgbldh8hrLrhmRUNA.text: This atmosphere is great. The dake rain huge fish tanks woldlife all around. Really beautiful. Service is a little slow cause its always busy. Great place to take the kids though. There smoothie I had was good. There food is fecent a little pricy for the quality of food but still a fun place to go.

pmjzfPlbwzOAhMcjTWbbcw.text: I hate even giving this place one star, and only reason to justify it is because MY food was not horribly  bad. I got the pita quesadilla, specifically because it was one of the only items under $12. I do not understand how this restaurant can charge so much for basic meals. $11 for a plain burger, plus $1.30 if you want french fries instead potato chips. $4.50 to add a small side salad, $16 for chicken fried chicken that was more breading than meat (my husband literally had to scrape off about 1/2 of the breading).   The waitress was kind, but misunderstood my mom (even admitted she misunderstood) about free refills for a drink. My mom asked if it had free refills, she said yes. So my mom got refills, and the bill came out and charged her $6 or $7 per refill. She tried to dispute it, but the manager was completely rude: he was shaking his head "no" the whole time she was explaining herself, and he kept saying "I'm not going to BUY YOU A DRINK"- as if she was trying to get out of paying for drinks when she really did nothing wrong. He ended up walking away and putting his backs to us after saying he would not give us any discount (off food or drinks- yet it was the waitress' fault). My dad had to literally yell for him to give us his name because he wouldn't respond.  He was extremely rude and unprofessional. I am a manager of a QSR and was APPALLED at his actions. We spent almost $200 on sub par food and he couldn't remove refills due to a waiter's error.   Additionally, the bathroom was disgusting. No toilet sleeves, paper towels were empty, and there was fecal matter on the toilet I went to use. The floor is caving in inside the stalls, and paper was thrown everywhere.   Overall: bad food, bad atmosphere unless you're 4-8 years old (way too many crying 1-3 year olds when the lightening and thunder starts up), and rude manager.  Will NEVER come here again.

m8hRZ_1ToJLdjCK6k4Li1Q.text: Today, my family and I attempted to eat at the restaurant. We had a party of 9 and there were many available seating areas but because we made no reservation (according to a very young hostess) we could not be seated. There was no line. We were waiting approximately 10-15 minutes before we even knew what was going on. Such a bad experience, especially when the young lady told my wife that if we did not like that we needed to make a reservation, we could go eat somewhere else. Really? We immediately got the General Manager involved and he had the exact same attitude. I will be in contact with the corporate office very soon to discuss the treatment we experienced. We are from Texas and wanted our kids to experience the Rainforest Cafe in Phoenix, AZ. Not a good showing for Landry's.

L4vPhDZHIMhW3TF-aEL4jA.text: Just went here tonight on my brother's dime, as he wanted to take my kids here for dinner. The kids are finally old enough that the thunderstorm doesn't scare them and the storms are loud enough to drown out their loudness. Our server was great! She had no problem hearing our order or other requests throughout the meal. She even had the kitchen throw in a couple of extra chicken nuggets for the kids meal my youngin's shared (and I didn't even ask her to). Got our money's worth there.   I do agree the prices are steep, and yes it is a themed restaurant, so if you go here, you should mainly be going for the atmosphere. Cuz that's what they are serving up. The food is good, so really 3 stars for that, but if this place can keep my 3.5yr old and 5.8yr old entertained (which it did) without any meltdowns or fussiness throughout the meal, that makes me happy. The salad I ordered was large enough for me to bring half home for lunch tomorrow.  The fish aquariums kept my youngest mesmerized pretty much through the whole meal. If the host/hostess doesn't ask, request a table by a fish tank if you are going here with kids.   If you shop only the sale items at the gift shop, there is some cool stuff.  Definitely a different place to go once in a while, but not the sort of place you wanna go too often.

9weoB-xTe2pr0JaDvKnOMQ.text: Went to this outdated, poor quality food, crappy dump of an eating place. VERY loud with the stupid monkeys screaming, thunder, over and over, scared my 10 year old grand kids. After waiting an hour for food I stopped another waitress and told her if we didn't have our food in 2 minutes we were walking out and they could take the food and cram it. She went to kitch and 3 people brought out this horrible sub standard food. Over an hour to get the worst food I've had in a very long time. Burger tasted like it was beef mixed with possibly ground turkey and freezer burned flavor. Bun was hard as a rock, chopped lettuce on burger was turning brown, grand son ordered mashed potatoes loaded with garlic (not edible) sent back for corn (ice cold and floating in water-frozen corn)microwaved.I will never go back to this place and will definitely tell everyone I know to stay away from this ripoff of a place, they should shut it down and go out of business.

i97uvUCbiwaDFJtqLtRGxg.text: Okay, before I go into this review, when you go to Rainforest you are not going for the great food or for an economical and filling meal, because you will get none of that. The food is good, but not outstanding. It is not economical and you will likely leave looking for something else unless you order an overpriced appetizer. It's basically like high end amusement park fare. Sure it's entertaining that the animatronics and the simulated downpour every 10-15 minutes is fun but if I'm going to pay close to 50.00 for two people to eat, I expect they we should not be looking for something else afterward. Okay so that out of the way...  We have one of these close to home that we don't go to, but we are on vacation and just got a gift card from the timeshare people for sitting through their presentation so we really had nothing to lose here  The food is actually good, there just isn't very much of it. My wife and I each ordered the Mojo Bones which is St Louis style ribs we ordered the half rack because the price on the full rack was clearly out of the question. It came with Cole Slaw and Fries. The Cole Slaw was tiny and the fries were good but not many of them. So on novelty I give it a five on value I give it a one on food I give it a three so then the average is three. On a side note we probably would not have tried it if we didn't get a gift card for sitting through a time share presentation. Novel yes, but personally for ribs I'll go to Chicago for Ribs.

cBOQINoGtNLBIxK0HEbfKg.text: As far as gluten-free dining, this restaurant was decent.  There was no special menu, but at least the waitress was knowledgable (she was the bartender in the lounge).  I was able to have a decently tasty meal of chicken breast with toppings (although they left off the bacon topping - not sure why).  They also substituted saled and/or fries with very tasty broccoli.  I wasn't overjoyed at this restaurant, but it was fine.    The service was very quick - we requested a speedy turnaround to get to the airport and they delivered.

05SuF5dfj9BOijAZSCwZRg.text: Ok i would totally give it 5 stars but its not worth 5 stars and i will say why. 1. its way over priced, but the sizes were pretty good for adult servings. 2. i was really on the fence about trying it because of some of the reviews on here and other websites. our server was a tad slow but again we came on a Saturday at lunch time so its a given that it will be busy. the food was good, what i don't understand is why does it take 3-4 people to bring your food out i mean come on whats the point of a waitress if she cant handle a table of 6. the lighting was a wee bit on the dark side. over all its only a one time deal only once a year. what ticks me off is that they have a kids menu but then they turn around and charge you extra for fries, when it states it comes with a choice of your side. same goes for adult meals. i was like WTF really charge 1.50 for a few measles fries, really ticked me off. then at the bottom of the kids menu it says that they can get a water bottle but they don't tell you it cost 8 dollars! good thing i asked about them. i think they really screw people on the price and hide the fact they charge extra for fries or any of that on their menu, because when ordering they then tell you oh that's extra, grrrr, very poor business practice on their part, such a same because it could really be a good place if it wasn't for all the hidden fees and charges on stuff. 3 noise level was moderate to loud, it got loud when the animals were going off and thunder and all that, other then that a dark cramped seating area all the way around, we got seated next to a huge family in more ways then one, and they wouldn't even move an inch so we had to move and pull our tables so our lil kids could sit in the chairs. 4. my daughters "dino" shaped nuggets are the same ones i can buy a big bag for the same price i got stiffed with. there were some deals in the gift shop and then even there they try to get you to sign up for their rewards thing, yeah right like I'm going to be back anytime soon. I don't know i didn't have high expcations for the place so im trying not to get overly depressed on the 90 bucks i had to pay for 3 kids and 3 adults..........sigh the things we do for our kids!

5fvsn0AeiXVjsZ8hJ4rnww.text: Had to wait 30+ minutes because kitchen was behind and they slowed down seating people. Asked for 2 separate bills but everything was on 1 bill.  Server never mentioned AARP discount.  Was told it would take 30+ min.  to get food and thankfully only took 20 min.  Children's popcorn shrimp and other food was ok which made  experience better and server did come back several times to see if we needed anything.  Prices are a little high.  It isn't winter visitor time yet so kitchen will need to Improve turn around times.  Have only been there twice in several years and probably will be several more years before next visit.

V8vy-fPU9Nu6RR2ofqcQkg.text: Service was great. Food is crap. I'm pretty sure everything is taken out of the freezer and cooked in the microwave.

3IdoN8ENy-k0f5swYm3jRQ.text: Hmmm, always the same food at every location but the staff here was lagging and if they had been more attentive i would have ordered a volcano for dessert...

MA4J_jth5wccaBkUQ4o4kw.text: My wife got a kick out of this place when she visited Phoenix for a debate trip in high school and thought we should try it while we were in town. The lobster dip was great and the wife liked her steak and potatoes just fine. My chicken & broccoli alfredo was great with an earthy taste added by the walnut pesto.  All in all, a good meal. The atmosphere is a bit loud, but fun. And you can always sit at the bar if you're not in the mood for the noise. I appreciated the spectacle of the whole place, particularly the large aquariums scattered throughout the restaurant.

PInnnwxUrCoG4uIDdaiLYQ.text: We finally decided to try this place. We will not be returning. The decor is so dated and reminded me of a chuck e cheese venue. However, it was dark and cool, so that was ok. The menu has decent variety but an average lunch was about 16 bucks. If i was spending that much at a gimmick eatery, then why not try the steak and shrimp? For 24 bucks, it had to be good right? Wrong. First, they forgot to bring the coconuts shrimp so a manager had to intervene. That'd because our waitress was nowhere to be found. The food was luke warm and of poor quality. The scampi and steak were completely flavorless and not cooked properly. There was no sauce that had flavor either. The shrimp was small and rubbery. The steak had so many fat strands that I could not cut it. When you see over half of the steak on the plate, you might want to ask the customer if something was wrong. Not once did anyone ask how the food was. Even when i filled out a comment card, they still didn't ask. I spent 70 dollars for 3 plates of food. Save your money and go get good food and service elsewhere. Not worth it! We will not be back. Want a gimmick place to eat for 70 bucks? Steer clear of this one.

uoPKWUvM84JoO5FSbw6e0A.text: OK, call me lame, but I actually enjoy this place.  I even go out of my way when I'm at AZ Mills to walk ALL the way around so that I can check it out.  Maybe it gives me just a little bit of that "over the top" VegasISH themed whatever (since I'm not popping for a trip to sin city at the present time), but it's certainly a kid friendly atmosphere.  You can't argue that it doesn't have much competition in the Valley of the Sun (and heat and dust).    So, I've perused the menu and would certainly not go out of my way to eat a meal here based on prior reviews.  I am, however, reviewing it based on my experience with a mid-day cocktail last week which was KILLER.  My partner and I ordered a large (21 ounce) Margarilla which is a frozen Cuervo Gold (I believe) margarita with orange sherbert.  It ROCKED and I had a serious buzz on the way out.  At $10.99 each, it's not cheap, however, the bartender did give us a souvenier glass to take home.  And, I got to sit on a zebra barstool :)

biAWC5yf-AVCiHVKBfj9CA.text: The only reason to come here is for the scenery.  It's always nice to sit right next to an aquarium, but it's a little overpriced for food that isn't anything special.

AzDFH49iMQNy52pFQD7qAA.text: Chicken fried chicken almost gave me a stroke because it was so salty. Bad service and poor management.

AMhLfd2JBHeytUT6NDmeKQ.text: Went with my sister, son and niece on Wednesday for dinner. We loved the atmosphere! Kids meals are only $2.99 on Wednesday's, so we didn't get a huge bill. My sister and I stuck with waters, ordered burgers and we had a $5 off coupon. So we got a pretty good deal! If I would have had to pay full price for everything, it wouldn't be worth it in my opinion. Service was leaning towards the bad side. They were definitely short staffed that day. Food was good but nothing to rave about. Great for kids and adults!

oZj0i_Y7W1fXh9c49J17kQ.text: We ate here for the first time a few weeks ago and it was really good. The appetizers were good, the food was good, and the service was good. Kids loved the decorations and all the theatrics. We had a great time.

T-TsTc50x7pXxlZ1F1QNYw.text: Your experience begins with a mandatory 30 minute wait. They want you to shop in their store before you eat. The service is slow. The food is no better than bar food. The novelty is fun for the kids but that's all you get.

Qx9YbTdj65pU46EWnaTodQ.text: I know people usually give this place a lot of hate and that's why I was nervous about going again. It was my first time going back since I was a little girl and I was not disappointed! The atmosphere was just so cool and unlike anything you can get st any other restaurant. While the food is pricy, it is a sit down restaurant it should be somewhat expected. My GIANT burger and fries was $12 and it was sooooo delicious. I will definitely be coming back again

NsNHO_jyQiisG7WFUCvXVg.text: Love this place,  its always busy but they do their best. Anne marie was very kind and promt with orders! Now food is mediocre and fish definitely need to be reintroduced into the restaurant, also a thorough cleaning or dusting of the leaves and animals would be great. Perhaps you guys should coordinate with the sealife aquarium to see if they would possibly host cleaning your fish attraction out front? That way your Rainforest Cafe could be once again complete!

Jp6DaPbfqtktYXVr7NXvBg.text: There aren't a lot of options for sit down service in AZ Mills Mall so we found ourselves here. The service was slow. We were super hungry so we ordered an app first and it too almost  30 minutes for it to arrive-- and 2 minutes later out comes out food. So our food got cold while we ate the app platter. We spent over $80 not including alcohol or tips and that was just 2 adults and 1 kid. Prices were outrageous and food was mediocre.

9VNVOB73EDUw-Zz2f2VnSQ.text: Quickly seated considering the line, but that's where the positive's end. Ordered strawberry lemonade and it tasted like dirty strawberry water - it was not drinkable. We ordered mozzarella sticks as an app, which didn't come until our meal did. And for our meal, my husband and I split the "Lotus Temple Trio," an unreasonable $26.99 for obviously frozen breaded, unseasoned shrimp; raw in the middle (effing disgusting) fish; and charred-beyond-edible chicken. Added a side salad - a whopping $6.99 - to go with our meal as it only came with a scant scoup of white rice, and half the greens were browned and it was missing the tomatoes. Took forever to get our food after we were seated and we were never checked on until the "end" (our food hardly touched) when asked if we wanted to order dessert. No thanks. And we'll never be back.

SRD6fLJqv4j98t4S2aEVfg.text: My daughter loves this place obviously because of the rain storm sound effects and animated animals.  We were seated promptly there was hardly anyone there on a Thursday at 11:45 AM.  Our servers name was Scott.  My daughter ordered a kids plate. I ordered potstickers I asked how many are in the order Scott answered "six cut in half " I thought his response was a little odd. But was intrigued to see what potstickers were like when cut in half.  When the server brought our food I was intrigued to see what look like six eggrolls. I thought perhaps since I've never ordered rain forest cafe potstickers that maybe they fry them? I gave them a try they were pretty good. My daughter loved her macaroni and cheese orange slices and watermelon.  When our server came by to check on us he said "how's the eggrolls?" I responded oh they are egg rolls because i ordered potstickers. He then said he would put an order in for potstickers right away.  I watched him walk into the restroom area. My water glass had a crack. At first I thought it was condensation as to why my table was so wet but after five napkins and wiping it was obvious the cup was broken.

gAQ2FLnefh475o8ZOGPGdA.text: I've loved this place since I was a kid, and I still do to this day. Now it seems to have fallen off a bit, the machines have taken a bit of a toll, and the food is a bit overpriced for the portions. But it's still good food and the atmosphere you get to eat in is pretty cool

e27XN4RGHtV5yFcRttkqqg.text: Long wait on a non busy Monday. About 45 mins to get seated. About 45 mins to get the food after that. Food was expensive but low quality. I would equate it to about dive bar standards.

V7zTC1sVHFZ_syAB1l3Kfg.text: Went there for my son's 10th birthday party.  Ordered BBQ chicken wrap and my son ordered cheeseburger sliders.  Our waitress didn't return for 30 minutes.  Our food took 40 minutes to arrive and the chicken tasted like it was canned and they used cheap sauce.  My son's sliders tasted extremely dry and not very good.  Very disappointed for my son.  When I said something to the manager she said that is standard for the kitchen.  Needless to say I won't be going back.

tFe8dgiDYYNnxbhK6vB-zg.text: This place is an amazing place to build memories. You definitely go there to the experience, you rather than the food. I got the chicken tenders and they honestly weren't bad - $16.99 for chicken tenders at a restaurant like this is pretty steep, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

h7qLy2XD-PACwED5aM2isQ.text: Put on a 20 min wait and there are many seats and lots of staff. Not sure why there is a wait. Came for the atmosphere for kiddos, hoping food is fast.

0phHeQlXEVUM2oLCBX4VWg.text: Really disappointed. No more fish in the tanks. Google it. Multiple locations impacted.   Food appears to be frozen. Ordered fish and chips, fish was 80% batter. So much fluff.   Service from servers are good, but ultimately the lack of quality in their food speaks volumes as to where the organization stands currently in its lifecycle.

bEUAhPGwqfxut4XM2BDBuw.text: This Rainforest Cafe location is like visiting the vestigial ruins of a cool 90's tourist attraction.  The plants are old, dusty, no fish in the tanks, water damage and rot on the ceiling.  Overpriced food with no rainforest experience.   Save your money, visit the Aquarium instead and go to Red Robin.

MrQgjN-5hG3OdE6eEaJw3g.text: I regret not reading the other reviews before coming here. The food was not good. Like "man, we should have gone to McDonald's instead" not good. Seasonal vegetables were I edible. There were five tables with people hit the service was incredibly slow, no refills on waters were offered / given, the mashed potatoes were rubbery, and the signature cocktail just tasted like jack daniels and water. There was nothing at all redeeming about this place.

tq9QplgFMNe7rH0ad0UwKw.text: So I read a lot of reviews before we came here and I was a little unsure of our pick. We were a party of 5 at roughly 1:45 in the afternoon on a Tuesday.   Lets start with the good. Seated quickly by a very polite hostess. We were able to pick our table and got to sit in a section we desired. As the price is assumably for the atmosphere it was decent (would be great of there were fish and not empty tanks). The food was also pretty good, nothing special but not bad by any means. Although I cannot speak to any fish as we avoided it due to the overwhelimg complaints. The portion size was large too and we all left full. We had the lava cake and despite there no longer being a sparkler it was great. The slightly older gentalman who is the manager was very attentive and helpful. Along with serving our food and drinks he was the one who brought all our requests like ketchup etc. There was also a young attractive woman server with dark hair and black earrings running her butt off to serve plates to many, many tables.  Now the bad... My wife's drink arrived after the food. We had to ask for silverware. There is clearly a disconnect between the front and back of house. The chef's/cooks were serving tables during our entire visit. Our waitress was not very attentive and walked past several times without checking in. Many of the servers were simple not doing very much while the manager, hostess, chefs and the one waitress were running the whole time.  Overall it wasn't bad. I will admit the lack of fish is increditablly disappointing. One of the things that is a cornerstone of the brand and it's missing. Assuming you are willing to overlook that and want to have a good time with the kids in the rainforest it should be a good time. Be willing to pay for the experience tho. We had a good time but might not be at the top of our list on the next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Club and grapefruit beer
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Right next to our table

7vTrGZL7jqTn6TqMuGG7KQ.text: I came to a place like this many ages ago and it felt like it hasn't changed at all. My waitress was friendly and gave great service. I had the shrimp basket with fries and it was decent. The only thing I have issues with are the gift shop items. The gift items they sell are way overpriced and aren't the best quality. Overall, this place is alright but i don't know if I'd come back here again.

N-hWHe0kZVzxriQedNEXdQ.text: We kept on putting off going here because of the bad reviews but never again. The service we received was excellent and the food was delicious. Hands down I give it 5 stars.

cCXJO2UFHlVVodUtV5DFHg.text: You don't go to rainforest cafe for a fine dining experience, you go for the atmosphere. It's a great place for kids.  I do appreciate that the chef comes out to go over the gluten free options with you. I ordered salmon which came with rice and veggies. It was really lacking flavor. The rice actually had the best flavor of everything on my plate. The vegetables were undercooked. I tried my daughters cheese quesadilla made with corn tortillas. It was decent. Despite only a two rating, we will go back because the kids enjoy the rainforest theme, especially when there's a storm.

CMt42Ex3IlCwPw3pCEiWyQ.text: This place was known for three things, high prices, bad service and cool environment. Now they've gotten rid of all the fish tanks that used to surround the restaurant leaving them with only high prices and bad service. We went for my daughter's birthday and waited in line for 45 minutes for a seat, on the way to our table I counted 17 empty tables and all the wait staff just hanging out in the bar area. It was so bad I had to take pictures to prove it. Then they sat us next to the mall entrance where people kept looking at us our whole meal and they would move us to one of the empty tables when my wife asked.

Rrd8xVZEVEGe_SutRr_hEQ.text: Have to say this place is still good after years of not going! Have a child now so wanted to treat him to something new. Restaurant only had about 12 tables full but our waiter was running around as were the others. That being said we did wait a long time for food but it was great. Mexicana burger was excellent and the service while slow was very nice. They are also great with kids.

i5GUYzFfiqfnonk713JZrw.text: Great place to take the kids. They like looking at all the animals. The shooting stars in the sky were pretty cool too. The service is just sooooo slow. We got here at 4:45 and didn't see our server until after 5. Pretty annoying. Then it took almost 30 min to get our food...on a Tue. It's not busy in here. Fail.

1vNFgLjcpwUcS7AwpQj49w.text: The noise,lights and animals are merely a cover-up for the slow service, lackluster food and expensive dishes. Don't expect to add a house salad to your $12.48 turkey wrap ladies and gents here they want 4.49 to add it as a side. $37+ later we won't come again.

NUVPxC40xyflMfIU321Sfw.text: waited 45 minutes for food talked to the manager she said i will discount your check when the bill came for 2 people it was $60 she took off $4 I would never go back

QeTTb1vJVQ3dv3SOigd0dg.text: Service is alright, food is nothing special but not gonna lie I love going here every once in a while with my little sister because it is just so unique! The place is decorated like an actual rainforest with fake thunderstorms, big moving animals, and gorgeous fish tanks! Not to mention the fun gift shop!  So no, I wouldn't go here if I was looking for a high end meal, but yes I go here to spend quality time with my sister (I'd even go here with my boyfriend for a date one night) in a fun, kid friendly enviroment. We love it!

PdesOL7YLXbcG3Y7o4quQA.text: First and foremost, for all the people saying this place is "Great for kids" and "Definitely a kid friendly environment" I have to completely DISAGREE with those statements.   Everything looks as if it would be kid friendly, the moving animals, the talking tree, pretty fish tanks, shooting star sky, monkeys swinging from trees, etc. NO. NO NO NO NO NO. Do NOT bring your kids here. I don't know how many times i've been here, but every time someone brings their kids here, they let their kids walk around the whole restaurant because their kid can't sit still. I also don't know what the waiters/tresses are thinking putting people with kids next to the aquarium, banging on the glass like that. For the parents who let their kids slam their head against the glass, SHAME ON YOU. Shame shame!   Also, out of the many kids that do come to this place (let's say we have 10 kids in the restaurant as we speak) at least 2 of them sit there and stare in Awe, when the lightning/thunderstorm goes off, while the other 8 cry their heads off. Sure, loud noises tend to make kids cry, it's a natural reaction. How can we fix this problem? Don't bring kids to this restaurant! Plain and simple.   However, if you are a couple of love birds, or just want to go somewhere cute with your husband/wife boyfriend/girlfriend, this place is great to go when it's not so crowded. I personally LOVE the atmosphere, and everything about it.  What I don't love is the high prices. As someone else said, how they get away with these prices is beyond me...If my fiance' and I went with just ourselves (2 people) and got 1 meal each and a drink, it would most likely come out to about 40 bucks. Basically, 20 dollars a plate if you want to round it up.   One time we went, and we ordered an appetizer and it (no joke) took us about an hour to get the appetizer. Our food got cooked before the appetizers were done. This kind of ticked us off, however, the lady was really, really nice and talked to the manager, and he told her to waive the price of the appetizer off the bill. She explained to us and kept apologizing, saying that they had so many people and not enough cooks that day so they were taking it off the bill since we didn't get to eat the appetizer before the meal. We gave her an extra tip for being such a nice lady and doing that.   Even after me complaining about little bratty children and their "i just don't care" parents, I have to say this place is such a wonderful place to go to if you just want to order a drink and enjoy a fake Thunderstorm. I'm sure the waiters and waitresses probably get mad at us, but everytime my fiance, my friend and I visit The Arizona Mills Mall, we have to stop in at the rainforest cafe to order an ice tea, just so we can sit and chat and listen to the thunderstorm. Luckily for us, we usually get seated right under the sky. My favorite part of the whole Restaurant.  OH, and one more thing. If they ever try seating you in one of the booths in the back that are big and rounded, don't do it if you're a bigger built person. You will have a hard time squeezing in, an uncomfortable meal, and a hard time getting out. I'm not a big girl, and it was even somewhat snug for me to sit back in those booths. I could only imagine how someone bigger than me would feel. Definitely need to make the booths have more room.   4/5 stars, If there weren't so many kids at this place, I'd have given it a 10 if I could. Crying kids with parents who don't care about their crying kids tend to always ruin restaurant atmosphere, peace, and tranquility for me.

q_rRKhCFoXPpo97ueSARow.text: I saw all the negative comments and had regretted getting a gift card before I even went.   But I was pleasantly surprised. We went on a Saturday night and the place was all ours. All the animatronic animals were up and running. I love the jungle decor. I just have one question: Why is there a Art Deco statue of Atlas holding up a neon-lit world in a primal waterfall??   Our server was friendly but I did have to flag him down for a refill of my drink. (That's always a sign of attentiveness--whether or not you have to ask for refills.)  I had the Pot Roast ($18) which was rich and savory. The beef melted in my mouth. The stew veggies were tender/crisp. The garlic masked potatoes were comforting. I ate the whole thing. My wife got the Mojo Bones half rack ribs ($17) which fell off the bones and was very flavorful with crisp edges. Both meals were piping hot with not long of a wait.   Yeah. They were a bit pricey. But you're paying for the atmosphere. Overall good experience and I will come back.

Vg8toOATNh9C6hn0NyXw9A.text: This place gets 5 stars for atmosphere and it is a favorite of my children for that reason.  However, the service always seems to be lacking in one way or another.  The food is ok and overpriced for what you get.  But, due to the fun environment, we will keep going back.

-n--5VSXrww0zfI078tG4g.text: I give it a 2. My kids give it a 4.  The food is passable, but I agree with all the other reviewers in that it's a theme park mentality...you're paying for atmosphere.  Been to the AZ Mall location a few times and I concur with my fellow yelpers on the "slacking service".  Last night we were a party of 8 for my son's birthday and the service was no exception to this...but! No one had to send their food back and my sons left happy. That's good enough for me and I think that's all the management shoots for as well.

VdpIvU29eJ-HXvxawhbBuQ.text: The food was average. My meal looked and tasted like something I could get at my work's cafe. The apple sauce that came with my daughters meal looked like it came out of her lunchable.

zJpjKJjpOKrptTNQQ7uxcA.text: Rainforest Cafe is a dream for kids and adults alike! The store outside the dining area is full of cool toys and stuffed animals and the aquarium pillar is absolutely stunning. The bar is incredible as well! Seeing the fish swim around is fascinating (as well as a good distraction for the children). If you're willing to lay down some serious money, this place is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

ZEiPrw80acVuUgECdTXjNw.text: Great way to end the day at Arizona Mills, good food at a good price with entertainment for the kids (me too)..lol A must after enjoy a day at the mall!

umXgTulijOha3o18nXkWbA.text: I took the kids to Rainforest Cafe today for lunch. While I know they aren't know for their food, how in the world does any restaurant that serves food that bad stay in business as long as they have? Our first clue should have been the fact that their chicken nuggets are dinosaur shaped chicken nuggets. I guess I didn't realize there were dinosaurs in the rainforest. No wonder I haven't seen a live one!  I order fish tacos and they were absolutely terrible. I send them back and the waitress says they aren't a very popular menu item and that she doesn't like them either. I then order a burger. How can you mess that up? Pretty easily, apparently. It comes out lukewarm and grey. I take a bite and it tastes like it is straight out of the microwave....ten minutes ago. I comment to the waitress and she sends over the manager. He comes over and tells me that 3 or 4 people have commented on them today and that they recently changed to a different type of beef and they now cook them on a flat top, no longer over open flames.  Enough said....thanks for the memories!

geOEyN9HNNmS7c64YC5DcA.text: Pros: Great family atmosphere especially if you have kids. Food is always good Service is a plus The ambiance and play on theme. Pretty cool little joint overall Good customer service.  I don't go frequently but when I do, the service never fails to deliver  Con Quite a bit pricey  In a nutshell,  if you don't mind spending more, or for a special occasion night out with your kids, this is the place to be. Definitely not somewhere I can afford to visit regularly myself but I have nothing but good things to say otherwise.

RUvEKk1ZJvuypHWBLhb5Hw.text: I'm a fan of this place. Very kid friendly, nice atmosphere and my son loves it here! I have to admit, the food is pretty good.

5tXVUa4w26rq8RlRx6N20Q.text: I don't go to the Rainforest Cafe for me, I do it for the kids. They love it there. We went there for a little trip to get out of the house for the day ( and If we are out of the house it also means I can't start the painting project I am supposed to do and it will have to wait until next weekend).  Anyway, We get there and the hostess tried to put us right next to the door so we asked for another table. They put us next to an aquarium which was good for me because the kids left me alone, but bad for the fish because the didn't leave them alone.  I got a hamburger with guacamole. the wife had an appetizer. the boy had two mini hot dogs and the girl had a pizza. the kids meals were the right size for them and my hamburger was pretty good.

L2mLTTrplfFMsm81YHpfmA.text: I had the Mayan mushroom ravioli very good. The lobster sauce put it over the top.

3vZE0YVnS5W5OXPvr1hnGw.text: I usually really enjoy the ambiance of The Rainforest Cafe. This one was pretty boring and the fish tanks had no fish here! So let's move on to the food.... The clam chowder, which was clearly microwaved, salty, and cold was just disgusting! We were all burping it hours after we left and all got a very upset stomach. The main courses were "ok" and the sides that came with it were also COLD and disgusting! We also asked for some orange slices for our 11 month old (usually given to us for free, she's a baby!) we were charged $2 for 2 TINY slices.... Should have just brought my usual lil Baggie of oranges to keep her quiet and happy. I mean $2 I could have gotten 2 big FULL oranges for that price! I couldn't believe the prices for the crappy food that was served. I will never come back again and my boyfriend is STILL having stomach problems 24 hours later. Only come here if you would like a good case of food poisoning that'll break your pocket. Save your money for a NICE restaurant with GOOD food. YUCK!

yqXTPBHdyiwMSF0ZkpKSgw.text: Rainforest Cafe has been one of my favorite places to go for many years. Yes, it's a little cheesy, but I always thought it was fun. I've been to a handful of locations around the country and the experience has always been generally pleasant. Yes, it's expensive for mediocre food, and the service is generally slow, but I always thought the fun atmosphere made up for that. I especially found the multiple fish tanks compelling. I often insisted on being seated next to one. However, I believe the love affair has ended. I went to the Tempe location last night for my daughter's birthday dinner. I was very surprised and disappointed to find no fish. None at all. Gone. Where there used to be tanks in the dining area are now covered with fake flowers. The huge circular tanks at the entrance and gift shop...now just filled with bubbles. I've seen the animatronic animals dozens of times. It's always the same. The one detail that made every visit different was the fish. Now I really have no compelling reason to ever go back. I asked our server where the fish were. She simply said they were "transferred" to the MGM Grand, whatever that means. That's not much of an explanation. Oh well, it was fun while it lasted.

AEXjmaIXpwznVU3Y1K6LPQ.text: Atmosphere and Service was great. I would rate that 5 stars! But food was...eh. I had the beef nachos and they were just okay. I've had better nachos at the bar. My cousin had the salmon and said it had no flavor. My brother had the steak and shrimp and said his steak was dry. I would only return to this place to have a drink because the atmosphere is cool!

ej5opkmkC65t9rGeaqlpdA.text: I was visiting the Mills Mall & I was very excited with the idea of trying the Rainforest Cafe. At first everything was going well, but soon after our order was taken we were quickly forgoten. I found this quite surprising since we mentioned this was our 1st visit here and the place was quite empty!!! The food was mediocre at best some of the order was even cold!!! Needless to say I will not be coming back

LSt0xxMRnzqHAcOU22vUYw.text: I wish I read the reviews before we went.  It is overpriced, mediocre food.  I got a "wrap" that was institutionalized and tasteless.  Server didn't even notice when he removed the 3/4 of the uneaten thing from me.  We weren't offered boxes for the kid's food.  The drinks were OK but not good enough to get me to go back.  Side note - I find it ironic that a place that is built for kids goes and scares the crap out of them every 20 minutes with a thunder storm.  I think my kid is scared for life.  $100 for lunch.   Jeez.

bH5NsyhCaxYwOjx5P3_79g.text: Usually I have a great time here. The service is nice but the kitchen takes foreveeerr on food so it is very inconvenient to come here if you make other plans to attend to for the day. Be prepared to wait 30 minutes to an hour just for an appetizer.  Other then that I still love the food here. :3

k9oSabw37Q7Z_JRDpBkd5Q.text: probably the only star I gave  is  for the decoration me and my family went in in my sons birth day after 20 minutes of standing without help we set down and asked for help they said sure and an hour passed no one there and when I spoke to the manager he defend his staff saying they are overwhelmed and you have to white since you set down by your own. by the way they have only two tables with people this day. I will no step a foot in this place as long as they have this manager there

4yoERodJX3hnvzRzOLpE2Q.text: Horrible service, 40 minutes and just have drinks, finally ordering food. Rude staff that doesn't offer to help move tables  for big group.

ZpDnTlNdH0kvgISrLG_fsw.text: Ok, no more fish aquariums. Expensive food that's so-so. Good service, thanks to Ryan, Summer, and Nicole. Next time ask for booth when RVSP.

zmn4t7kMXkkuMnECmAhMxg.text: Service was horrible. We were sitting down for about 10 min before a waiter even came to ask us for drinks and than when we ordered. SRLHgk6D4hROgLtz9EwkZg.text: Fun atmosphere. Great for kids but the food wasn't anything special and was somewhat overpriced. Overall it was an enjoyable meal but more for the environment then the food. The staff was friendly and attentive.

Tu1iDdtLCapSdMw5W_i1Kg.text: Me and my boyfriend ate here about a month ago and the service was fantastic! And it actually feels like your in a rainforest! The hosts were also wonderful too! Telling us the names of the animals! I'm not a fan of thunder but thank goodness it's not too loud  over all I would go back a thousand times for the service and food!

P4XlTYEyvpysjWnyXsi1GA.text: 3 because of the environment/staff not the food. The food is so so. The reason I give this a three is because it was so loud in there my kids could yell and I didnt care. the staff was very attentive, courteous, and quick to keep the drinks filled and fulfill requests for dips and dressings.

vEray9NP_A1qnxUtckxkoQ.text: The good, fun for kids. My daughter enjoyed her Dino shaped nuggets.  The bad, prices are high for value/food, and you have to walk thru the gift shop on your way out.  The ugly, poor service. The hostess walked around and kept us waiting for 10 minutes in a virtually empty restaurant. She did not greet us, tell us to have a nice meal or say thanks you on our way out. Really a glum, sloth like woman who would best serve this restaurant by washing dishes....far away from people.

TcukiddTKcb1Bg8tTvZ3Cw.text: The only reason I gave this place two stars is the decor! Stay away - it's such a waste of time and money. Took a half an hour to get our food and when I asked the waiter about our food, because it had been 30 minutes, he had the nerve to correct me and said " it's been 25 minutes". I guess that is acceptable?!?! The food was bland and way overpriced. I always knew it was a tourist trap and have stayed away for years, but my son wanted to go. NEVER EVER AGAIN.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. BBQ Chicken Wrap - very small, hard wrap was not easy to chew and all that was in it was shredded chicken with sauce on the side

Jf2DHxbY6IZmmHj5boHh_A.text: Waited an hour to get our food when the place was empty. We were a party of 8 for a work lunch. The drinking water tastes like it is out of the fish tank

-p0Vtlbu1OCNS6LI9KANcA.text: I don't know why you'd come here without kids, unless you were just in town for a short period of time and trying to combine shopping and dinner with an old friend before you head back to the airport.    If you had kids, this would probably be great -- there's plenty to distract them -- animatronic animals and booming thunderstorms and drinks served in blinky rocket glasses.  You could probably even finish your overpriced meal and knock back a drink or two before the critters started actiing up.  You could even purchase a toy at the gift shop on the way in and hope to finish a dessert.  This will only cost you an arm and a leg, standard amusement park pricing.  If you're just 2 ladeez trying to catch up, this is probably not your venue.  There are kids and families all around -- happily, their ruckus won't be too annoying because all you can hear are jungle sounds and thunderstorms.  For a "save the animals" themed place, there sure was a lot of meat on the menu.  The only veggie options were cheez sticks or a veggie burger.  I guess I could've gotten the shrimp pasta sans shrimp, but I balked at the $17 price tag.  I did like sitting next to the enormous fish tank and having them peer at the progress of my dinner.  I was just glad I wasn't eating one of their pals.  I don't think I could've handled the bug-eyed gaping.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

Qf3F8FrSNUsH5KaLJFJkqw.text: I'm giving the store only a one star because I decided to buy a couple of aquatic small fish toys. The lady said they were $14.50. So I bought two. Later I realized they were apiece. Currently I seem the same item being sold in another mall for half that price. I brought those items back. I refuse to pay double the price for anything. I thought it was a total ripoff. If a store who claims to support a cause decides to double the price should be ashamed for ripping people off.

5Bho-5X7F8Tc8KwyodhgZg.text: Love the atmosphere and the people there! I went and the hickory chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans and it was delish.

TIFS2xvedI0bjE3LqmuK1A.text: Definitely paying for the atmosphere at this place. I figured with all of the cool decor the menu would be a little more creative and expansive but I was sorely disappointed. I thought something was up too when we were there on a Saturday afternoon over Memorial weekend and the place was pretty much dead.  The artichoke/spinach dip was pathetic, and actually tasted like they put a lot of pepper (ew!) into it, and the chips were stale. I asked for a medium rare steak, and it came out damn near mooing and running around the plate as well as smelled funny (my son ate most of his as we split the plate before I got to mine so I couldn't send it back). I will say that the ribs were good though. Food quality was NOT worth the price I paid for the food. I paid $2.99 for a LEMONADE! UGH! Lunch for 2 - about $50 out the door tip included.  We got seated next to the large fountain, which at first I though was cool, and then I realized that my son and I could not have a conversation, and I was getting damp from the mist. It is sooooo louuuuddddd in there! If you are looking for somewhere to have a conversation this is NOT it!  Of course I got the usual crappy service after I told the server that we were going to split a plate (restaurant portions are too big,  so we always do this.)  Will not return.

UksU352z9DfNZrt9Xh-Y3Q.text: Everyone was very sweet. I came alone and often get overlooked, not so here. Amber kept checking in with me even though I could see she slammed! And the hottest as well! Let's just admit you are not coming the this place for the food. But the experience and staff are awesome!

B2neh8CXKJGPBIlbO9TWpg.text: Super slow! Just in case if u will have Charlie server, better refuse his service & ask for another one..... Brought just drinks in 15 minutes.....I asked for extra plate...... Yes, he brought .... way AFTER I finished meal.... Really? But he immediately brought a bill! He knew he screwed up!!!  I had to edit review ..... He brought a bill , yes without a pen! Had to call near by server for a pen!

2cMs4twNDlDKk_AwoU0A2A.text: Great experience. Kids 2 to 12 will love it. Nice place for a casual date while walking around the mall, too. Warning: The food is very pricey and not very good. the fish is fried in batter so thick, it's had to find any actual cod in it. In general, the food portions are good size, but not good quality. You must try the lave chocolate volcano for desert. They give you coupons for the attached store, but watch out - there is always so many restrictions and conditions that they don't really work.

pPeZpVb37kdgbZib5JYjOw.text: I don't want to post such a bad review, but it was such a horrible experience for our family and would want to spare another ones' troubles  :(  No organization, we were there for over an hour because of a long wait. Water wasn't served. Burger was almost dropped in my lap when finally served. As I was about to take a bite the waiter pulled the meat thermometer out of my burger.  Drink was super watery. Bathrooms were unsanitary.  I felt robbed of $100 after this dining experience

SiaGFZopedtwcHFNeJC1_Q.text: Went to grab an early dinner at about 5p for a child's birthday. The restaurant was 90% empty. Hostess tells us there will be about 15-20 min wait because there's only 2 servers working. Really?? Management are clearly incompetent. Looking forward to this tourist trap closing down to make room for a real restaurant.

gdhpRFuxefOL7d2GeKl78g.text: We had a pretty great time here despite the negative reviews! The only super disappointing thing is they have NO fish anymore in the tanks... we were really excited for my son to see the tanks but they were empty. So one star off for that.  Our nachos were great! And my burger was a good burger... don't go in with crazy expectations, this place is about the experience for kids and my son loved it! His pepperoni pizza was good (although the whole kids meal was $8 kind of pricey)  Our server Justice was attentive and very nice! The only thing I would've changed is the price. But $65 for 2 1/2 people (plus an alcoholic drink and 2 sodas) isn't too bad!

XmePjUw6LQZupxEh5kawmQ.text: A gift shop disguised as a family-friendly, kid-oriented restaurant. Not worth a second trip.  Service was decent, but friendly smiles and cheer don't do much to bolster a lackluster product served at exorbitant prices.

8NERdN26xI6iDsExHQefhA.text: This was my family and my first visit to this impressive and delightful restaurant. We dined here after walking the entire length of Arizona Mills. It was nice to be greeted by a warm and friendly hostess whom seated us at a comfortable booth. Our waitress was lovely and attentive. She brought our refreshing drinks to our table quickly and took our order. She knew a lot about the dishes on the menu. Our food was hot, fresh and delicious. I ordered the seafood platter. Everything was tasty served up with shrimp scampi, butterfly shrimp, tilapia, hush puppies, coleslaw, fries, spicy cocktail sauce and tartar sauce. My son ordered the cheeseburger quesadilla with fries; my other son ordered a cheeseburger with fries and my daughter ordered a lettuce cheeseburger wrap with veggies as she has to eat gluten free. We enjoyed the entertainment with the animatronic animals, the lightening and rain. It was a wonderful dinner and a treat. I highly recommend dining here if you come to the mall.

MApNFXdHCmWIbhLUpO0AtQ.text: Its a novelty you pay for here.  The food has never been great but you get that cheap thrill of a dining adventure with your kids.  Service lacks and food is mediocre but somehow its still a good time

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kids hot dogs... At least my daughter enjoyed them
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

c9bkqMKa0yT4HyAG2CtXDA.text: Yes the setting was cool, but quite frequently it made it hard to have a conversation. The food was overpriced and not good as well.

GXs6tNdOU7ptWb0Rhmnc5A.text: This is the best restaurant that I ever seen in Phoenix Az. a really great experience for all the family. we enjoyed a really fun time here. The food was really good and the staff is nice but you have to be there for feel the complete magic experience that they offer

cqYTxpdQ3p4Of_10Lzf2xQ.text: What happened to this place?  I grew up eating at this very Rainforest Cafe on family vacations.  We used to have to stand in a long line and wait to be seated.  Now, it seems like the place is a ghost town and I can understand why.  On my last visit, I saw a dead cockroach on the floor near the kitchen.  The bathrooms are musty, dirty and the floors are sinking in places.  The food is awful (it used to be delicious) and ridiculously over-priced.  The hostess is always rude and she seems to get off on telling you that they do not allow strollers (my bad; I thought this was a place for kids, but I'm not leaving my $600 stroller unattended at one of the biggest child trafficking hubs in the country).  What happened to the fish, by the way?  They've made so many cutbacks that they've killed the experience.    Would it kill them to seat you near one of the exhibits when the restaurant is empty, anyway?  Why do they always want to seat you near the bathrooms, the kitchen or the mall when you could sit next to the water?  It makes me sad.  They need to clean things up quick or I don't see how they will be able to stay in business much longer.

rUU526CaezVBof8g3xnuuA.text: Kids like this place. They got rid of the fish in the huge salt water aquarium, which was the main reason we went. The food is actually pretty decent but there's something off about this place.  Our server was great but the kitchenwas incredibly slow getting our food out. I like the fake thunderstorms, but the fake plants hanging from the ceiling everywhere (to make it feel like a rain forest) look very dusty like they haven't been cleaned in years. Weirded me out to eat under them....just doesnt feel clean to me. I will say the tables and floors seem very clean.   Overall 2 stars.

6UqYdcWSW9JaiBfmZifW9w.text: The atmosphere was great, but the food was really weak. 3 adults and one kid spent $90 on dinner! If you want good food, go somewhere else. If you're willing to spend a load of money for a pretty neat atmosphere, then this place will do.

YgPAvwzLFg1unOsB6d5voQ.text: MOLD IN THE KIDS CUPS! I have never felt the need to write a bad review about any place besides today. When we went to the rainforest cafe, it was for my daughters second birthday. I tried to make a reservation, but was told they were booked but only had to wait ten minuets for a table. After the short wait, I had what they call a "passport " in my hand and walked up to what I believed to be a host stand. Someone grabbed the passport out of my hand (a hostess named Gabby), without even saying anything. Another host asked if I had been helped when gabby came by and said "I got em" and proceeded to take us to a table. I asked Gabby politely if we could have a table next to the animals because it was my daughters birthday. She ignored me and said " I'm sitting you here." Another employee came by and so I asked them which they obliged, but Gabby said "ugh I guess we can move you." I then asked her her name and she quickly became a different person, offering my baby a balloon. The table wasn't a great one, I could tell she was annoyed and didn't want to sit us somewhere else, and I wouldn't have ever asked, but it was my baby's second birthday. Anyway, we bought a cup with a frog lid to commemorate her second birthday, had so so service (which whatever its more for the atmosphere), and went on our way. I still had a bad taste in my mouth from the way that hostess treated us but still wouldn't write a review until we got the frog cup home and it's head was full of mold! I'm so pissed, I saw almost every table in the place get one of those cups, and it makes me sick to have a place especially for kids have cups that could them really sick! Awful!!!!!!!!

MOYaPWZP7Tix9R7VBMCg5w.text: rainforest cafe used to be a fun  and special experience with huge fish tanks, thunderstorms, and outgoing staff. We used to take our kids here for special occasions, paying a bit too much for "just ok" food because the experience was great.   Now the aquariums have all been taken down, the fish have been taken out of the entry way tanks, the restaurant is empty, and the poor staff just seems like they understand that they are at a dying place.   It's sad; Rainforest Cafe seems like they have mailed it in and are just waiting to die. We had come regularly for almost two decades; now i don't think we will be back

NDqGSrr10GekPlUqUFk4Uw.text: Highway robbery for gross cafeteria food. I went today knowing I didn't care for this place. But I was with family and my kids so It was more about "the experience."  Never. Again. My kids could've cared less about the experience and the place feels damp and dirty and noisy. All the surfaces felt sticky. The women's restroom is like a death trap. Slippery tile floors with soap and water all over them and you can't even turn around without jumping into someone or something. Tiny and disgusting. I didn't like what I ordered last time (the veggie burger) and the coconut shrimp and fries today were like long John silvers at best. And to pay these prices is ridiculous. Our server was nice so I can say that. But we waited about an hour for our food to arrive. Neverrrrr going here again. You will get better food and a better atmosphere eating at the food court.

UAZFKFRfCiLwnpUpPCN6sw.text: Terrible! Service was horrible! The tea taste like they used toilet or dirty sink water! I had to give it back it was that bad. The club sandwich was poorly put together, the lettuce had brown stuff on it. The menu they gave us had tons of stuff that looked good but the waiter said they no longer had any of the items. Yet it's still on the menu. This place has really taken a crumble. Used to be on of my favorites when I went to Phoenix. Can't eat there again. Last few visits have been not good at all.

HSPItpAAcAhjZOV2VfEE5Q.text: I come to Arizona once a month or once every 2 months and my family and I usually visit places I haven't been. Rainforest Cafe is fun for kids and family. They have 3D moving animals while you eat that will keep the kids entertained. The menu on the other hand was too expensive. For a one year old Mac and cheese, 2 adults meal and one hotdog for a 6 year old; came total of $116 not including tip. Outside they have a little store for you to shop. I would suggest not to go here if you are tight in budget. The food is not good for you to pay $30/plate. I'd rather go to a fancy restaurant and get really really good food for that price.

ome9hqL2MDsGLlI3U6la3g.text: We had a great experience yesterday. Our server was great and the food was delicious and plentiful. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is that it's VERY pricey compared to same type/quality restaurants. And, the bathroom was tiny. With babies to change, it was so hard to fit. I got bumped into like 5 times with people coming in and out which is hard with a little baby.  Will come back.

lR22xigrICGAlYln1Xr7Kg.text: We came to celebrate Mu granddaughter's 4th birthday. We had a great time, she is growing so fast.   Small mishap, her mom brought the cake with her. The waiter offered to take it back and put the candles in it and come and sing...well.. he dropped the cake. We knew he did and we were all in a quandary what to do. My granddaughter picked the cake out and was looking forward to having it. So, they came out with a special Rainforest Cafe cake. Well, she was not happy and cried and cried, big huge tears.. oh it was so sad. Her mom and I almost cried too....but they more than made up for it... they took care of the bill and brought her a few gifts. They did a good thing, as it was an accident. Oh and the food was pretty good.

ODpDHF-2U8tlpC0qrPcQcA.text: Going through on business decided to enjoy the atmosphere there. Was seated 45 minutes before closing with only about 5 tables with guests, and 20 minutes later I got up and left. Couldn't even get attention of anyone to take my order. Plenty of staff there but everyone seemed in their own world. Hostesses had disappeared and couldn't even find anyone to complain to.

_TQuXmyaYDK51BOgucBlwA.text: When I got there it was very noisy, I couldn't even hear my self think there was to many kids crying and yelling. It was very quick to get a seat but to get a drink it was 5-10 minutes and the food, I  saw other people getting there food before us and they just came here. This place is horrible worst place I've ever been my pizza ordered with cheese was not cheesy it had no cheese on one slice and it didn't taste like pizza I tried to order desert but they had only one ingredient to make the desert so. I didn't get one also the reason why I came is because my sis wanted to come soo badly. Here is a pic of the chez pizza
