1vY1MlSf8QArmtLZWjjSRQ.text: We came here because it was my Son's choice for his birthday. If it wouldn't have been for his birthday, we would have left, even though it's a hour + drive from our home. As others have mentioned, the service is very slow. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated even though there was no one in front of us. Once seated, we had to wait a while before our waitress came. By the time she came, we already knew what we wanted to order, so we went ahead and gave it to her. The group sitting next to us got their food before us. About 10-15 minutes after that we asked the manager. After he checked on the order, he informed us that our waitress had not put in our order. He then offered us 50% off our meal, and put our order in. We got our food fairly quick after that. I was hoping to be offered something small prior to our food, but no such luck. Everyone was pleased with the food. My club was just an average club though. When we got our check, they charged us for an adult size soda with the kids meal. It was supposed to include a drink. It was also my son's birthday, so we informed them. They came over and sang and gave him a cupcake. They then charged us for the cupcake also. Oh well, at least we got it for 50% off!

5fXvuGkfdyQU-fzebXwrxw.text: This review is for the bar service. While waiting for a movie we wanted to grab a drink 20 minutes before the mall closed. We stopped by Garcia's and the bartender was so rude, we went over to Rainforest. The bartender was friendly, fast, and even made a custom drink within 20 minutes. Drinks were good and we were happy!

0z_voSY1nLgudYWn3Rdu4Q.text: Went here for my first time in a very long time. Was seated right away. Ordered 2 fish and chips and 2 chowders a Bloody Mary and 3 draft beers. On one fish I asked for the veggies instead of slaw. Only one chowder was brought waiter thought we were going to share, other soup was brought out about 10 mins later after food was brought out. Neither entrees came with the veggies I asked for. The rest of dinner went fine. Bill came out and we were charged full price for soups instead of the add on with dinner price. the waiter tried to say it was because of tax but eventually checked menu and fixed it. We were charged $9.25 per draft beer and no one told us it was because we get to keep the cups it comes in that we never wanted. Had to look over a menu on the way out to double check draft beer prices to find out we get glass cups. Bartender was mad we didn't keep our dirty ones and was ignoring the waiter trying to get us our cups.. Ridiculous. Staff seemed so overwhelmed and it wasn't even that busy. $100 for 2 people for horrible service and average food.

ERMwaKip5Nx3aNBBYSC3Uw.text: I would rather be a freegan and dumpster dive then ever swing into the Rainforest Cafe again. I would rather eat..... ....at the worst Applebee's in America ....vending machine food ....my own flesh  Now, Rainforest could be fun if you were 12 and drunk. Then the overly fried foods and canned sauces could cure your munchies. I would have rather had Totino's pizza rolls than the nasty appetizer combo we shared. The plant and animal filled space could really use the services of Merry Maids. Really. How do you clean all that crap?   The rainforest "thunderstorm" is as exciting as the one in the produce section at Safeway. So if you have kids who like to drink, you might have a good time here. Otherwise I say stay home and check your trash like a good freegan.

eSy5Sl9t6Kmdh4XKAlu5Tw.text: way overpriced and super slow!!!!!!! we will never return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! save your money and don't go!!!!!!!!!!!!!

vjuG_7wm6BxZqYY4ZGo6rw.text: ATMOSPHERE: Fun, if you have kids or if you happen to like a fake Disneyland environment like a modern day Tiki Room.  FOOD:  Really bad and WAY overpriced!!!!  SERVICE: Very poor...I think they hire Food Servers with no common sense or any people skills.  OVERALL: Save your dime...mosey on over to the Food Court after you stand there ogling over the animatronic alligator and fake fog. Paying for overpriced, crappy food with bad service is NOT worth it.

zvM8seKLFn2sXECJntGLVA.text: This place is so overpriced it isn't funny! The food is sub par, the Rainforest noises are too loud. There are kids running all over the place and the service sucked!

ofvae03wIAvckNPywbi0SA.text: Great place for kids. Food was pretty good, service was great. The restaurant features gigantic toy animals that come to life with movements and animal sounds. There is a faux thunderstorm that occurs every 20 minutes or so, that makes the animals go wild and cause a ruckus which kept my 3.5 year old daughter amazed. She was entertained the entire time and ate her whole meal - chicken tenders in dinosaur shapes and broccoli. There is a colorful jungle themed bar for the grownups.

ey6b9dTwTo0ra3Ae0to_Uw.text: This is only good to go to if you have kids.  Food is overpriced and they sure like to add too much pepper and believe its called flavor.  Only good thing is the atmosphere.

rYbQdhIzZqQKeWnW1YH_xA.text: This place could use a good dusting.  When it first opened everyone was amazed at how "real" the plants and animals look.  Now - they look dusty.  Very, very dusty.  Now I'm guessing it would take even more that a massive dusting to bring back the days of 2 hour long waits and lines to get in the doors (Yes, it was like that for a LONG time) but it sure would help.    I have a friend who loves the food, so I've only been there with a child once (sad I know).  Every other time it's been with all adults.  Yea, it's Disneyland cheesy, but it's also kinda Disneyland cool.  You have to appreciate the work behind some of this stuff.  And remember - it's a theme restaurant. It's supposed to keep it's theme front and center.  And yea, it can get a little loud.  Especially if the gorilla starts going off on one of his long rants as you're trying to order.  But I've never really had a problem with it in hearing the group or giving our order.    My favorite part honestly is the archway between the restaurant and the gift shop.  It is a giant fish tank.  No animatronic fish here.   Real fish.  And it's pretty freaking cool.  But the star it might gain from that it immediately loses for the prices.  Just like many theme restaurants, they are overcharging you for the food.  Of course they have to cover the costs of maintaining that fish tank and all those animatronic animals.  So while I kinda get it, it's still too much for a regular dinner.    Their gift store is almost another review in itself.  Again, a bit overpriced, but they honestly do have some really cute stuff.  I've gotten a few small things here as gifts over the years for kids who are in that "I love animals" phase of life.  Always a hit.    When your aunt and uncle with kids come into town and want to go somewhere different that the kids will like - You'll get big bonus points for bringing them here.  Other than that, it has a fairly limited audience.  And dear heavens, don't bring anyone who is an OCD cleaner.  They may never leave.

ClHOlhwytXNSKwJ-XUf5WQ.text: No, not a fan at all. I gave this place two stars just because it kinda reminded me of going to chuck e cheeses with some of my wonderful childhood memories.. A lot of furry creatures moving around making noises and horrible food. My husband ordered a burger meal, and I ordered some beef wrap. Like someone said below, Apple bee's is a better bet for this type of bar food. This place would be rad if you were a little kid, but I will never eat here again..   Oh and the food is way overpriced. The two of us ate with tip for like $40, they charge you extra for their dry french fries 99cents, and a side salad $3.99.

JqHcEokPt7M8KqUWVnPoww.text: This restaurant is more for entertainment than for grub. I brought my four year old niece here after the Sea Life aquarium for more fun entertainment while attempting to get her to eat some lunch. It was pretty empty and thus the hostess let us choose wherever we wanted to sit. I asked for the best locale with the most animation and she sat us next to the elephants. Once my niece's high pitched scream of "elephants, look at the elephants, Tasia, look at the elephants. No, look there. There's the elephants" stopped we were able to sit down and take a peek at the menu.  The restaurant offers a wide variety from a Chinese chicken salad to coconut shrimp, to a few different cuts of beef. I opted for a side Caesar salad (minus the Caesar dressing) with a raspberry vinaigrette dressing that left the romaine lettuce looking for croutons to used as life preservers. The only plus to the side salad  was that it did come with a very scrumptious rosemary infused roll. I also split a burger with my mom that was okay. The cook did a good job getting my medium temperature request right, but the burger just lacked flavor. The burger usually comes with chips but we opted for  "safari fries" which again, were okay. I guess being sprinkled with Old Bay flavoring qualities for the "safari" title. My niece got the Mac n Cheese that she devoured pretty quickly which is rare. My suspicion leads to the fact that she just wanted to run around the restaurant and look at the other animatronic animals as opposed to it being outstanding Mac n Cheese. The atmosphere is pretty rad. They really do a good job with the rainforest theme. There are misters over certain parts of the restaurant (not directly over patrons), sparkling twinkling lights on the ceiling, a few fish tanks and many animatronic animals: elephants, apes, a cheetah, and an alligator when you first walk in. Every so often (maybe ever 30 mins?) there is a "storm". The lights dim and flash and the sound system plays thunder while all the animals make noises. It's definitely a great place to bring kids and definitely not a quiet restaurant.  Based on the food, I'd give it a 3 star rating maybe 2.5, but the atmosphere deserves a 5 for what it successfully accomplishes. I also like the fact that they have a donation pond when you leave (or enter, but I missed that going in) to through loose change into. That is where the animatronic alligator is located and it's fun to try and get the change in his mouth when he opens it.

UE0JftvDqYspxzGZhsCo-g.text: We took the kids and great-grandma to the Rainforest Cafe after the Arizona Sea Life Aquarium.  The restaurant is fantastically decorated and has a great gift shop. We signed up for the Safari Club card, it cost $10.00 for lifetime membership and we saved that on the gift shop and our meal, then we'll get a $10.00 gift certificate to use on our next visit.  The food was just average, nothing to write home about, but the decor was worth it!  The kids and I really enjoyed the animatronic animals, the inside rain, waterfall and lightning strikes and thunder.   Our services was average.  It was really nice that grandma's wheel chair fit nicely under the table and was comfortable. We really enjoyed the total experience.

2p573ll_ZiW8H2aTzTdcPQ.text: Terrible and overpriced!! Had to ask three people for a spoon, ketchup, and nobody came back.  Ordered a chopped salad...halfway through it, sans dressing because it was awful, I realized the chicken that seemed extra soft, had blood thT squished out of it when poked w fork. Told waiter, And his First response was ...let me go ask the chef about this!!! Elbe returned with my bloody chicken salad an place it down in front of me, informing me that he'd seen chicken do that at other restaurants in town, and the chef said it was fine to eat! Ummm WTF kind of morons do they hire???? He even charged us for the thing!!! I complained to manager and handed complaint cArd to him...and said we were not retiring! What a disappointment!

ptJbWQBV3yoBR-2oBpfm8Q.text: After both (1) reading some of these negative reviews, and (2) having had our own mediocre experiences in Orlando, we were a bit concerned about taking our kids to the local Rainforest Cafe.  They love the "experience", so we went.  I'm pleased to report that the food was above average (including the fish-n-chips, which in my experience is often poorly prepared).  Portions were large, staff friendly, and the experience better than what we had gotten annoyed with in Orlando.

-1I_VFE2CofpVZSTXEilZA.text: My girlfriend and I were sat down promptly and had our drink orders taken.  Once we placed our food order (I had BBq burger...Well done, she had shrimp with veggies)  We got our food about 45 minutes after ordering with no apology from the waitress. The food tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for the whole time or in a microwave.  My burger which was supposed to be well done was rare. (Complained got no response from anyone) my girlfriends veggies were still frozen together. (Complained again with no response from our server.. other than I can have them make you new ones for an extra charge.)  Little bit of a bad experience when I asked for my check a bus boy dropped a hot plate which crashed against the back of my chair. And without an apology or recognizing he just went about his way while my back is covered in sauce and im sitting on broken plates and knives all over the floor.   I mean maybe it was my day to have something bad but I know during a lunch rush things like this should be handled better.  Hense why I didnt tip the waitress.   Will never be going back to that restaurant or any other chains the company owns.

dT09RVgVKITdEUGRlNSFVw.text: The Rainforest Cafe has below-average food, small portion sizes, and subpar service, and it is WAY overpriced. My husband and I went for dinner at about 5:15 on a Saturday night. The line of people waiting for seating was very long. I noticed lots of parents and kids waiting to see the hostess for a table in the dining room. In typical "me first" fashion, some patrons chose to bypass the line of families by cutting through the bar area and approaching the hostess station from the side. I'm not sure how the hostess didn't realize they had cut the line by going around. But their tactic worked, because the line-cutters did get seated in the dining room before everyone else that was waiting in line. My husband and I decided to go into the bar to ask if the seating in the bar was first-come, first-served (as is often the case). We stood at the bar, hoping to ask the bartender if we could sit there. We stood and waited...and waited...and waited some more. One bartender ignored us as another bartender kept going back and forth to two women because all their credit cards were being denied. Finally, I sat down at a bar table just to rest my feet. At that point, a waiter approached me with menus. I asked if we could sit there and he said yes. I called over my hubby, who was STILL waiting for a bartender to acknowledge him. After perusing the menu, we ordered the tortilla chips and queso sauce for an appetizer. It was over $8. We were served a tiny bowl of Velveeta type stuff on a large plate with a handful of stale tortilla chips. The waiter didn't even give us appetizer plates, so we had to keep pushing the bowl on the plate back and forth across the table so as not to spill the fake cheese. (He did not come back to check on us; otherwise I would've asked for appetizer plates). For dinner, my hubby got a shrimp platter with 3 different types of shrimp. He said the meal was just "ok". I got the veggie burger. It, too, was maybe "ok". It definitely wasn't worth its $12-$13 price. My husband had a soda and I had ice tea. When the bill came, my hubby looked at it and said,"oh, wow". He doesn't usually say anything like that unless he really feels he's overpaying for something. Later I learned that the bill was over $60 when the 15% tip was included! $60!!! We didn't even drink alcohol! That's just too much money to pay for lazy servers and bad food. Skip it!

EG-rK7ThOA3ixQV0ekuLBw.text: Well...take the kids...they will love the atmosphere. Do not go expecting any more than 2 star food..it really is not good food at all. The atmosphere is the only attraction..period.

NGKDyDnZTiTvrF8oF0bV9w.text: I was very sick when I went here so I had soup and a smoothie. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food. It was priced as you would expect at a theme restaurant, not insanely expensive, but not cheap. My friend had a good experience at the one in Orlando, but said that the Disney World one was superior in terms of the Rain Forrest animals. I was told beforehand that it was sensory overload so I was sorta disappointed. I think much like the aquarium that it's fun for the kids and that's what counts.

8eZOuxmGAFdpiVoRFihBbA.text: Took my son here for his 5th birthday yesterday along with 7 other family members....they refused to sing Happy Birthday to my son (it was an arranged birthday party); 2 of the people that had the fajitas are now extremely ill...this place is awful and should be shut down. Our waiter was always missing and every meal we had was cold.

MYcU5mMqfRn6N0c0VRA1LA.text: I Always come here when I get to Phoenix but sadly there was a long hair in the food. Waiter was horrible. Never going back.

zQQ0D0qQTn9nVueJD7UkzQ.text: We will never come back! Your menu says the quesadilla burger has pick which yes I know has jalapenos, usually diced & NO seeds. Your menu does NOT mention this has FULLY SLICED JALEPENOS WITH SEEDS in the quesadilla burger and I got very sick! The waitress offered to bring me something else and then CHARGED ME FOR IT!!!! TERRIBLE SERVICE AND MENU WAS NOT CORRECT. U NEED TO WARN PEOPLE WHEN IT HAS SOMETHING SUCH AS JALEPENOS (WITH SEEDS) IN IT!!!!!! manager was not notified nor did she stop. She just walked by numerous times. At least do not charge me again for your mistake. i got very sick and luckily had my medicine on me or else it couldve been terribly worse! I am appauled!

0sHOCYHVFg5mfGz5uMUlGw.text: This place is pretty cool. We stopped by here really quick on our way out of the mall and decided to grab a drink and a snack. I have been here before but it's been a few years, so I was excited to try it again. I love the way this place is decorated. It's all decked out as if you were in the rainforest. Huge fish tanks, vines, leaves, trees, bushes, rain, even animatronics animals. It's quite the place! We sat at the bar and their barstools are actually formed into different animals, which is a very cool idea. We decided on a few drinks and ended up ordering an appetizer to share. The cheese sticks we had were very good! Nice and crispy on the outside and the cheese was warm and gooey on the inside. The marinara had a lot of kick to it. It's a really basic dish, but I can't tell you how many places I have been to where the cheese sticks are hard, the cheese isn't melted or gooey and marinara taste like watered down tomato soup!  The staff was very friendly; the atmosphere was really cool, it was a nice place to grab a quick bite! I can't wait to come back and try a main dish and sit back in the restaurant where all the action (animatronics) are!

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

QHnbvg9PLko-hPACrmEIEQ.text: I was in the area and decided to have dinner and it was nearby and I hadn't been there in years. The restaurants display was awesome and just like I remember as a child. Waitress was really nice. Food was delicious a little pricy but the restrooms need some work.

nR6EX0G1i7y7z7a97oylqA.text: I've been here 5 times only because my kids love the atmosphere, but the food is overpriced and not that good and the wait is so long.it takes 10-20 minutes to get a table on a Saturday for lunch, when it's not that busy. 30-45 minutes to get your food. 20 minutes to get your bill. Don't go unless you plan on a 2-3 hour meal.

jShD8XZRtwO39jaUWQhhig.text: My favorite salad "China Island Chicken Salad" has disappeared from the menu, as has a whole bunch of other items. We are sad and basically got up and left without ordering anything. We will call before we ever visit any rainforest again just to see if they brought our salad back, if not well ~ adios!

3RyWMzKf3x8UUWVuE955aA.text: So this is probably one of the worst cafes out there. All Spanish music the whole time. Poor food. Sorry very poor food. Don't put a piping hot plate in front of my toddler. Ask the parents if you are not that bright. My wife almost broke her neck in the bathroom. Why are the floors sunk in a tiled room stall? Cracks in the floors. And allfor the prices that Disney would be sorry about charging you. Poor service ...yes my son is STILL waiting on milk.   ***Update** Both my wife and son contracted food poisoning from this place and puked for over 24 hours. Please stay away from this place. This was a horrific experience that we are still going thru. I hope more people read this and the inspectors come out.

hsN0iS7B9cTawrVMJka5Tw.text: I arrived at the restaurant and waited ten minutes before a manger said hi to me. She asked if I've been helped and I said "no, I've been waiting here to see where a host is." She mentioned I was at the right spot but the host was walking around," for ten minutes? I was hungry so I thought I would still come in and eat with my fiance. If you drink more than one cup of water at dinner, don't come here, they will never refill it. Also, our waitress brought out the wrong food and she could tell my fiance didn't eat it and didn't say anything. I mentioned to her it was the wrong food and we felt like she ignored us until it was time to pay the bill. This was the first and last time I come to rainforest cafe. Over price food, and you don't even get what you ordered. Service was bad and no fish in the fish tank.

OVZYgQbhim1b2zVA6eeO4Q.text: Setting obviously why everyone comes here. Food is of theme park quality and price. It was rather empty when we came and still took forever to get our food. Wife is gluten free so they have their chef come out to talk about options. All they do is substitute, no special gluten free noodles or pizza. Wife ended up getting a burger with lettuce wrap, but the lettuce was barely big enough to wrap the burger. Kids loved the animatronics though.

oow5fr1umIkf2KuIodMygQ.text: One of the worst dining experiences my family has had in a while. Mediocre food, long wait for food after ordering (35+ minutes, and we arrived when the restaurant was nearly empty). Both adult orders were incorrect as well. Prices very high even if it was an even halfway decent experience. Our five year old enjoyed the handful of animatronic animals but still got bored.

Ffgfj2GPDAnl1sCvfO6pHg.text: I was not impressed. Too expensive. 20 min wait for then sat next to restroom. Too dark to see what i was being served ad pretty noisy. I would not return. Definately not worth the wait nor money. Do not go here! This place is more for looks and not quality.

QSZfPGN-pM-AYwXcNcYOFw.text: Been to this place too many times and it never gets better. Bums me out because the kiddos love it but Rainforest Tempe are beyond unorganized, food comes out cold, hard and nasty plus it takes over an hour to receive. Please clean up your act...we really want this place to be good so we can come back.

9-AH2zUAYNpG1_o15nYEOg.text: I am basing my rating on how our server and chef accommodated our sons food allergy. Our son is very allergic to peanuts and when we notified our server she had the chef come out and speak directly with us.  The chef pointed out what our son could have and took notes specific to his allergy.  As a parent with a child with an allergy it is very refreshing to have this kind of attention given to his safety.   It is also a 'fun' spot for kids to attend and entertaining for them.  As for the food quality I rate it slightly above fair, but that is not why you come here.

Pziha7lVbTcHWDacw7CaRQ.text: Our waitress of the day was sienna. She asked what we wanted to drink and one of us ordered a specialty drink. When she brought it I said isn't in supposed to be in a special cup. Her reply " I would've had to charge you more and I know you did want that... Know what I'm saying". NO, I'm sorry I don't know what your saying. Then I asked for plastic cutlery ( as I always do). Our food arrived after 30 min. However we had nothing to eat our food with. I had to ask another waiter. When we finally saw sienna again I asked for ranch and Tabasco. 10 more min pass, she asked if I needed anything and I said yes the ranch and Tabasco I asked for and more water. Someone else brought the ranch and she brought Tabasco with three drops in it and said let her know if I need more......smh. The manager walked passed too many times to count and said nothing. When the waitress came by again, I asked for more Tabasco she laughed and said ok. She came back with another bottle within two or three min. And this bottle had no top and dried up all around the opening( in the picture I posted) I asked another waiter for more and he brought it right away, I was already so annoyed I didn't get his name. Anyhow I do love this place because as a parent of a 19 month old, I want her to see the cool atmosphere. This was our second time here and both times we had bad waitresses and I feel like it the management that's not on top of things so the staff does whatever they want

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

cOR4j8ueWYVu_wdTydVTGw.text: It had been a few years since I was last here but the moment they brought the food in i remembered why I don't come here. The food is bland, the kids are brought food on prison trays (not kidding). It's a sizzlers with forest decor. Service was friendly and prompt. I won't be back (and I'll remember this time)

vOWF2YrDLINn-F-o_eIQIg.text: I've have visited this location many times and have always had a great time. Today unfortunately that is not the case. My experience was terrible. After being seated I had to wait 45 minutes for my food, shortly after the person who joined me received there food first before mine. Upon receiving my plate apparently they change the menu during the week. Expecting to get the Planet Earth Pasta, I in fact got spaghetti noodles instead of pasta noodles. The noodles were watery and the marinara sauce was bland. The entire situation is just unfortunate. Well, just thought I would share, perhaps someone else has experienced something similar.

9nOgI6qDW-Zpf5ik6io-eA.text: You're paying for the atmosphere when you come to rain forest Cafe. Kids and teenagers would like this.  As far as a date with an adult not so much. Kids friendly, menu is priced high, regular American menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Little bit of rum...perfect mixture!

qHMYv8FdxBiovZHW6-Gc1Q.text: Rainforest Cafe holds a nostalgiac place in my heart, but it disappointed me a little tonight. The place was surprisingly busy and I don't think the staff was equipped for this. The waitress was awesome and attentive as she could be, but was still absent. Unfortunately, I was given RAW onions and tomatoes in my mixed grilled seasonal veggies. The waitress apologized and offered me another side but I was unable to get the raw onion taste out of my mouth until after our meal. Besides this, the atmosphere was fun and the other food was average.

Xtl75GzMGIdWldSqm7mLlw.text: Wait long time and price is so high. I have order meal and drink that cost me 35 and food is cold with bad quality. environment is noisy

k2jDJ1TCJmkz6i-Sx6eBoA.text: This was a fun atmosphere but the service was extremely slow and the food, mediocre.  With a large party of people--we took out-of-town guests-- and it just felt like we sat and waited and waited for everything. They restaurant was also really quiet so it wasn't due to a crazy time of day or anything.

58CLhS79GV6WAPdhAY-EjQ.text: Went here with high expectations for my two kids. Everything went great until my wife received the burger she ordered. She ordered a well done bacon burger that came medium rare so we sent it back... No big deal. The second burger came and the middle was completely raw. This was extremely frustrating because for a menu that has much more complicated like seafood, chicken and streak cooking a well done burger should not be too difficult. By this point, everyone else had finished eating so she opted not to have a third burger come out but wanted to let the manager know so that they can fix this issue in the future. The manager came over and was extremely rude, having a retort and argument for everything we brought up. We weren't complaining about it, but rather just raising the concern over someone possibly getting food poisoning (which she may have gotten if she hadn't have cut the burger in half). We then spoke with the general manager who happened to be in the restaurant this evening and he was much more receptive and apologetic about the situation. Other than the shift manager being extremely unprofessional and rude, the service was great and the food was not bad (a little pricey, but not bad). Will not be going back.

ooMjegrebERPMqco6Klg9Q.text: Was in the mall shopping for some things so we stopped in being that it was my daughters first time, the atmosphere was neat and my daughter absolutely loved all the animals and asked to sit by the waterfall they hostess sat us right next to it so that was great! It was steady our waiter was great and he was attentive and never let our drinks get empty and checked in with us often. I will tell you I was disappointed with the food! The three stars are for our waiter who was on top of all of it but for the $80 I paid for dinner for 2.5 people It just seemed to fall short. The prices were a bit high I just assumed that everything would be great and it wasn't. I'll probably never come back, waiter was atmosphere the food ! It's a shame because I had heard so many good things about this place !

w_iZDhRyaXf3Ii1vhMOhIg.text: Was looking forward to enjoying a fun dinner here with my wife and baby and was totally disappointed by the hostess right away.  We were asked to put away our stroller and we told her that we'd fold it up when we got to our table.  She didn't acknowledge us at all.  Immediately got on her head device and started talking shit about us to whomever was on the other line.  Uhh WE TOTALLY HEARD WHAT YOU WERE SAYING! And we also saw the face you made.  You could have kindly said that we don't allow strollers in the restaurant and we would have kindly said that's fine.  Horrible and just rude customer service.     With that being said our meal was pleasant and our waitress was very polite and very professional.  Only giving this 1 star mainly because of the hostess.  Definitely needs to be replaced and out of the hospitality industry.

zpSVwdO-KgM06pVnCzHsvw.text: The service was good but the prices are outrageous.  Over $20 for some coconut shrimp and most meals are comparable in price. Was not worth it. Plus a lot of screaming kids because they were scared of the robotic animals.

-yamukXWiVLXOSseK0yjeg.text: I had carry out. There were not a lot of vegan options, but the food available was awesome (quinoa spaghetti with no cheese or bread and kale quinoa salad).   The staff, not so much. The bartender ignored me for a long time. She was making drinks, but even when looking my way did not acknowledge me. Once she did, she was helpful with accommodating my vegan food request.   I'm a Landry's member and the manager was called (by the bartender) to take my number. The manager walked right past where me and my son (both African American) were standing (at the end of the bar near the registers) to a group of white people sitting at the bar (near the end toward the exit of the bar area into the store). She said, "I heard you were Landry members looking to add your number." They looked at her and said no. She continued on, like they were mistaken, "You're not Landry members with a carryout order?" The manager was sitting right next to me with her back toward me and I shook my head and rolled my eyes as the customer she was talking to again explained they weren't the group she was looking for. I said it was me, then the manager turned her False smile and cordial tone my way. I do not want to automatically assume it was a racist act but it was certainly biased and rude. I'm also quicker to "blame" the manager and bartender's overlooking me on the restaurant being semi-busy than their implicit bias toward African American patrons.   I won't visit that location any time soon, if ever, but if anyone asks for food suggestions I'll recommend the location, citing  my experience as a warning to be on the lookout, with the caveat that it may not be the norm.

yaWIgUJqR85_K6J09t0tWg.text: Definitely not what it used to be. Not sure what has happened over the years but even my daughter picked up that it's just not the same anymore. Just progressively got/getting worse and worse.   Not sure they have hostesses working there. Took 15 mins for someone to address us and I never saw that woman again the entire visit. We almost left after 5 servers passed by and didn't even glance our way. No sign saying wait to be seated or seat yourself. We weren't quite sure what to do but stand there and wait to be addressed or even be given eye contact.   Server was nice and laid back. But maybe too laid back. Took forever to get drinks, never got refills until we flagged him down to ask. Asked for appetizer plates. Didn't get them until we were almost done with our appetizer and actually was given kid trays bc they were out of plates.   Food was okay but not worth the amount paid at all.  Burger was over cooked and dry. Fries looked and tasted like they had been sitting in old grease before being served to me. As far as price goes, I get that you are paying for the experience as well. However when the food and service was subpar ... kinda drags down the entire experience.  I must say the highlight of our visit was the sweetest little old lady face painting at the entrance. She made my daughter so happy after she felt so disappointed in what used to be her favorite restaurant. I was shocked when she said she didn't want anything from the gift shop bc she always got something from the gift shop after lunch.   Oh and the bathrooms were beyond terrible. I don't even want to talk about it.

S5l1bNgjIfxxBXZyBvQsYw.text: Menu has totally changed so my favorite pita quesadillas are gone. Got the rasta pasta instead which now has corkscrew rather than bow tie pasta. It tasted like $19 Mac n cheese with a few red peppers and spinach thrown in. Mine had zero broccoli :( but it took 45 minutes for them to make it even though there was nearly no one in the restaurant. The server earned all the stars for cheeriness. Unfortunately, none of the animals move at this location so it was pretty boring. RC seems to have far downhill if this is their new par. I've been the a couple other locations in the past and loved it.

nQosp4krOV1ACOdX0Ahm7Q.text: When we arrived, the first thing we noticed was that there were no fish in the aquarium.   Our safari guide/waitress led us to our table, but not before pointing out where all the animals were hanging out around the restaurant.  Soon after being seated near the elephants, there was a thunderstorm and it was the first of five! The elephants were super loud. Plus, the unpredictable weather made it hard to talk.   The food was great. We loved the drinks and the fact that you can keep your glass cup as a souvenir. Just be careful -- they're fragile.   Overall - great place for families and good drinks to help make the safari more tolerable

r5hgK_k9KmRWHXLmoNOEJA.text: It's been a while since I had been here. Even in the middle of the day all the animator can are going and are VERY loud. I had to shout to be heard and we were even at a table deliberately away from some of the "animals." This is more of a place for kids.  Our server was very friendly but was not focused. We each had a salad, different ones.  We waited a while before server came back and then waited again for a while when we requested our check. I looked later at my receipt and he had put my table mates lunch on my CC and vice versa. I know we didn't hand it to him that way. So I guess you could say we bought each other lunch. Won't be back. Too noisy and inefficient and also pretty expensive. I don't mind paying if the food is superb. This was okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Elephants come alive!
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rainforest cafe by our table

nP8tOgnmSPUYV20lCxrxgw.text: I have been to the Rainforest cafe in MN before and thought this would be the same. A lot of stuff is broken-no fish in the fish tanks, no movement from the characters that are on the walls, dark lights-nasty floor, etc. The food was ok but very expensive for what you got. It cost us over $100 for a family with 2 littles. YIKES!

a5Os3WYVysje-5g8WPXYuQ.text: The food gets a 4. I'm taking away 3 stars for the service. The manager was real nice. Checked to be sure our Landry's card was up to date since we moved to Arizona. He also apologized about not knowing how to run a gift card etc in the store. It doesn't give you extra points anymore like it used to. (We found out about that after the fact.) Our problem was with the server. She was a real dip!!! The place was pretty empty. Our problems started with the soup. We waited a while and the server to come back to our table to find out what happened to our bowl of soup. She said it was kind of strange that we didn't get it already. I understand this problem would be worse if the place was busy but there weren't many people there. She said it was put in the window by the chef and was run by someone to the table, but we didn't get it from that person. We got the soup and that was good. Our drinks took a little time to get refilled and the server was not as attentive like she should have been.  The last straw happened after we paid the bill and she took the souvenir cups off the table to dump out the ice and package them up.  She was talking too much and spilled the ice all over the table and some of it got on me and my wife. She apologized but really kept smiling about it and didn't compensate us in any way possible. Also, she didn't even clean it up in any way! She was like oops that never happened to me before. Really dumb! Especially for a $95 meal I think was a bit overkill. She got my new shirt and my jeans wet from the ice and it was a little sticky!   My wife and I were a little shocked.  Like the restaurant and the atmosphere.  You need to hire competent staff and lower prices a      little bit and then maybe you would be busier on a Sunday during the holidays.  Your phone conversations are useless after my review was put up on yelp. I did speak to a manager but nothing came out of it.  Telling me your restaurant was technically closed and we were still seated. The most informative thing I was told is that the souvenir glasses we should have taken home should have been new ones from a box. The server should have given us a receipt to take to the store. Ice would not have been dumped all over us and the table if your server knew that!

MRMjVDXKYDqhERB2gNQcfg.text: This place is an awesome place to visit our bring out of town family for a unique and fun dinner. Honestly the food itself isn't the best and is over priced, but the appetizers are pretty good, so we usually order a few to share. If your kid is sensitive to loud noises they may find it scary to eat here. Every 30min all the animals make noises, with thunder and lights flashing.

bcurQrIxIG9DJFOoY6PPhw.text: You would think for the amount of money you spend at RFC it would be amazing food. Wrong. This location really let me down. We were visited 2 times throughout our dinner by our waiter and one was to take our drink order and the other was to take our food order 23 minutes later. Yes I counted. When we asked to speak to the manager a woman came out and she acted like she didn't have a care in the world. Don't recommend this location at all.

7-Z0eNYUQXeb7P3z9Z1qKg.text: This place has been here as long as I can remember, but I've only ever had one good experience and today was not that day. We went to the mall to do some shopping, and really just wanted some appetizers as a light snack since we were planning to do a family dinner at home. We got sat without a wait, as it was at the tail end of the lunch hour, and there was plenty of open seating. Being gluten-free, I was extremely limited in what I could even order. I settled on the spinach and artichoke dip for $11 in lieu of an $18 salad option. The rest of the family did the Adventure Appetizer Platter with a little bit of everything, and a hot dog meal for our 2-yr old daughter... I'm surprised we were able to even order off the menu because the lighting is terrible. The table next to us pulled out their cell phones and used the flashlight function to read their menus. We were lucky to sit halfway under the lone dim light bulb in our section... once the food was ordered, the kid's meal came relatively quick, but the adults sat for 40 minutes waiting for APPETIZERS. And it wasn't even busy! We were legit looking for our server to cancel the order and leave, but the next time we saw her she was carrying trays of food. EXTREMEMLY overpriced for the serving sizes (especially for an outlet mall), TERRIBLE service, and the food is honestly not that great. The schtick is the animatronic animals and decor, but that is hardly worth what they charge for your meal before you exit through the gift shop. Do yourself a favor and save the rainforest from ruining your day, and go to Garcia's across the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

5e1TuRULmFwnj5oxo-StUA.text: We just ate here tonight and they have stepped up their game well at least our waitress did she had a great attitude and was always there when we needed something. It's a fun place for kids.   I was really surprised by their French onion soup it was delicious and we all shared the dessert that has dry ice in it super yummy.

Dh4CBqqIDf9igijTH1HpPw.text: Went here for a date, the food was good when we finally got served. Waited 1 hour for service and they 1 hour and 40 minutes for our food. Got there at 6 pm started eating at 8:45 pm. We went on a Wednesday and they seemed heavily understaffed. Won't go again probably.

nuBEYl1fSW4-AZTR0rzOGg.text: Last night I brought my family, who flew into Phoenix the night before, to Rainforest Cafe.  I thought it would be perfect for the 8 year old with us because of the atmosphere.  What an embarrassing experience.  After placing our order, we waited an entire hour before getting up and leaving the restaurant (without any signs of our food).  The restaurant had three other tables going, that's it.  Our server checked on us ONCE after 45 minutes to say "it will be 5-10 more minutes, I will put my best guys on it." Little did we know the last laugh was at our expense. Prior to leaving I asked to speak to a manager.  Waited another 10 minutes for a manager to show up, and they could not even figure that out.  There's really no wonder this restaurant, as a chain, has lost its relevance in the last ten years. We had 10 people with us--and with their prices that means at least $200 walked out the door with us. I was horrified to tell my guests, "we should just go get a bag of burgers because this is ridiculous."  Sure, go for the atmosphere, but do not expect any kind of service.  FYI that was my first time "walking out" of a restaurant in my entire life. Embarrassing and pathetic.

2zpL9Ku8dxakxWR7qkVP5g.text: The best thing about this place was their appetizers super yummy. Souvenir cup was so cool, didn't know that was a thing until now. Food arrived timely, service was good. Great for kids! Their kids trays almost look like prison trays, the kids food is quite a big amount which is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

czoX0tBY0G218erDpxm64g.text: Expensive & mediocre experience- Visited to celebrate 6 yr old's birthday on Dec 26, 2018. There were 9 of us. Server took order, 2 of us ordered Four Peaks IPA out of a choice of 4 drafts?!?!  By the way, there is NO PRICE on menu for draft beer but BEWARE a 21 oz draft is $ 11.75!!!  Really?  The wrong beer was delivered,  had to politely mention that it was wrong & was exchanged. With only 4 drafts, maybe better training is needed? Several dinner items were ordered including shrimp, burgers, chicken & 2 kids meals. Had to ask for spoons for the kids apple sauce & extra napkins. Shrimp was "meh", burgers were ok, chicken overly dry. We went for the children's enjoyment of the surroundings, decor, animal sound & motion. The restrooms were filthy, the floors & stalls spotted with ??? & the wastebasket overflowed with trash on the floor!  Where is the manager? $17-19 burgers, etc definitely NOT WORTH IT!  For 7 adults& 2 kids our bill without tip was $255. Food quality, service & cleanliness were terribly lacking!  Will never recommend or return!

G_3JtNLVHc_SNCJjOEl7VA.text: Unfortunately we come here almost every year for NYE with our kids and it's always a great time with games, balloon drop, "champagne", ChaCha, and lots of goodies for the kids. The $12 children's buffet this year got them about 50 cents worth of candy and service that was less than acceptable. It's unfortunate... pretty sure we won't be coming back for this event.

nMsUYFHGJFVUbWdzQI6LJw.text: OK, my daughter has been asking to go here forever, so for her 11th birthday we took her. I have not been since 2006 at the Mall of America in MN, and previously in Florida. I knew it would be overpriced, but it was so much worse than that. First of all, there was not enough barrier between the seating and the mall, and as I watched the dusty animatronics I could see the shoppers strolling by. The vines were so dusty, and have off the animation was not working right. The rain used to seem so much more intense.   Next the food. First - bring your own water - every drink tasted like sanitizer!!!! We had the waitress rinse the glasses and bring more and it was better, but than the refills tasted like a band aid again. Next, some of the portions were decent - my father in law got the fish and chips - it looked good, had cole slaw and fried. I got the coconut shrimp - about $4 more - had mini scoop of cold icky mashed potatoes and 8 small shrimp stretched on a skewer. Literally, my daughter's kid's plate had more food on it and that was other people's comments not mine. The shrimp did not taste bad, it was just a sorry excuse for almost $20! It should have had a veggie and maybe a salad or bread to boot!  BTW, my wife who is 1/3rd my size had the same meal and also walked away hungry.  So, ambiance was lacking -- it looked like a tired old carnival ride. Food was way overpriced, food portions inconsistent.  Than, I said something to the manager. I waited until it was over because my wife hates it if  I complain, and it was my daughter's birthday. All she said was sorry. I could tell she has heard it before. There was certainly no customer service going on here.  For the next birthday I am going to blow the money on a birthday party instead of a nice meal, or else, go somewhere good for food and find entertainment elsewhere.

HXRVay4Cy_67a-UqWl79eg.text: Lousy customer service nobody there to seat you or get your name on a list. They most horrific experience. Recommend you go some where else

CdbmpklSgy1fGhiw1Xxu2A.text: I went here for a fun lunch with a friend and her new baby, but instead... no one greeted us, there were hardly any customers there to begin with. Once I asked to be seated, no one took our order. I went to the cashier's area to inquire. When our order was finally taken it was delivered wrong. My friend, being polite, started to eat her shrimp on her salad, when she had ordered chicken. The server offered to "pull" the shrimp and bring chicken. How do you pull shrimp off of someone's plate? He saw my look of horror so he said his manager was being very nice and sending chicken. I had several strands of short black hair on my plate, as did my friend. It was so awkward, we hoped they were strands of hair from the monkey swinging above us, but I think we both knew better. I couldn't wait to get out of there. Oh yeah, my mule drink in the brass cup was good. All in all, overpriced, thus empty...lackadaisical servers.

Nj__4qr7KkX-LwlqbQPR-w.text: I should have read the reviews before going. Our group had a few toddler-aged children with us, and yup, the noise scared them. It is a cool (even though kitschy) set up, and seemed like it would have been a kid-friendly place, but it's probably better for older kids, maybe 5-6ish. So, that's one thing (and not the reason I'm giving one star because, well, I guess I should have known) ... but the food, wow ... now I wasn't expecting spectacular food, but OMG it was awful. My body feels polluted after eating here. The kids' Dino nuggets were the best thing I nibbled on. Hubby's burger tasted like rubber (he said), my coconut shrimp was dipped in batter, rolled in sugar, fried and then rolled in sugar again, and the adult tropical beverage was a joke --- waaaaaay too syrupy sweet and hardly any alcohol.

X49omD7Clz4cdIujyq1TBA.text: The worst service ever!!!! We went after lunch time, so it wasn't busy.  We requested ranch with our order & didn't get it. We requested it again from the food runner, along with extra napkins...nothing!  We finally flagged down the hostess & she reluctantly took care of it. The chef was nice enough to come out & discuss my sister's special dietary request, but still messed up the order. Food was mediocre, but the lack of service is a deal breaker.

iggHZIA1LHmtxV1c3y7rAg.text: Terrible. Both me and my son got sick after eating here. All the fish in the tanks are dead. The gorilla is falling apart you can see all the metal like a bad terminator. The food was over priced. We had a hot dog and the signature burger. I will never go here again

jsnivpT982uzHgdPI8cdQw.text: Came by here earlier this week during a trip to the Sea Life Aquarium. I used to come by many years ago when my other boys were little. I was very disappointed to see that they no longer have fish. They removed the tanks from their dining room and the tanks up front just have bubbles. The fish used to be a highlight of our visits. Our party of three ordered 2 appetizers, the spinach-artichoke dip and barbecue chicken flatbread. The appetizers were very good. I ordered my usual, Volcano Cobb Salad and it still does not disappoint. My youngest son had their kids grilled cheese. My bill with tip was a little over $90. The place is not cheap, the food is good, but I miss the fish.

R4Wh_zRxW5jhEuvPAtuQng.text: Not impressed.... This place is obviously popular for the ambiance; if you like tacky decor and loud noises you found the right place! About every 8-10 minutes there is a loud "thunder storm" complete with loud cracks of thunder that drown out your conversation and flashing lights.  The menu has good potential but the food you get is nothing like what is described. Our waitress didn't write anything down, which isn't a problem if there are 2-3 people. We were a party of 5 (haha) and I was nervous that things would get forgotten. Things were forgotten. I had the Chinese Chicken Salad and a "Cheetah-Rita." The margarita mix was WAY too sweet and I couldn't tastes the alcohol (I may also have a drinking problem.... Yet to be determined). The dressing was about the only thing enjoyable. The chicken was dry like it was from lunch yesterday and may have been overlooked then. My best friend had the Chicken Parmesan and subbed mashed potatoes for the pasta but they brought out pasta anyway... Also forgot the applesauce that was to come with her son's pizza. One of the other girls in our party ordered nachos and asked to have a few things left off as well as extra cheese. The nachos came out with little cheese and all of the things she asked to have omitted. My sister seemed to enjoy her lunch, or at least was not vocal about it.  Upon coming to check on us, the waitress asked if everything was ok and exclaimed "Oh no the cooks didn't read the ticket!" Cooks are not stupid and were certainly not too busy to ignore special requests. Waitresses who don't write anything down are prone to forgetting things.  Almost finished with our meal and my friend and her sister were not offered refills. Regardless of how far into a meal you are, the waitress or another staff member should offer a refill.

TPjNl9L_-wvfFrD_hmF_zQ.text: Went in today with the husband and the kids and it was awesome. I was a little skeptical because of the bad reviews, but I wanted to try something new that the kids could enjoy so we tried it out. The atmosphere was so cool, the staff was extremely friendly, and all our food was awesome. It's not a place we can go to often because it is a bit pricy, but it is defiently a place we will go to when we have a little extra cash and are in need of some family time.

rAohnnzpiFYkHP99CBu4Bg.text: We were seated pretty quickly, but it was 8 minutes before our server said hello, even though it appeared he only had two other tables.  When he finally arrived he got our full order (since we had plenty of time already to look at the menu)  Then nothing.  40 minutes later we walked.  We would have been fine waiting that long for food if the server had said a single word to us that entire time, but nothing.  Our kids were super jealous of the other kids that got the paper frog hats.  Even as the manager came and checked on the other two tables our server had he skipped over us.  We finally tracked down the manager to ask if we could get the check for our drinks.  He checked with our waiter, and the hostess told us that we could just leave - not to worry about the drinks.  (She was super nice)  As we were leaving the manager caught up to us and said our food was out if we wanted to stay and he would give us a discount.  We decided to leave anyway because I didn't want him to think that we were putting up a fuss just to get a discounted meal.    Everybody else looked reasonably happy.  I just didn't really feel like spending $25 a person for terrible service.

3KVpNOwzgUlORAJ1vEddBw.text: AMBIENCE: Very noisy. Bring ear plugs.  Constant noise in the 80-90 Db range, spiking to 102 Db when the gorillas acted up or rain storm started (Decibel 10th app on iPhone 5).  FOOD: The food was only OK. Nothing special. The clam chowder was watery & the rest of the food lacked flavor.  Our 7 year old loved this place but did not care for her chicken strips or her Icee that arrived half melted.  SERVICE: Slow. Glasses of water were not offered & there was a long lag between when my wife's ice tea & our 7 year old's ICEE & my lemonade arrived.  VALUE: The food was over priced.  Dinner for 3 was $77, this included an appetizer & souvenir cup.  WILL WE REVISIT? Probably not.

5IriuzdKwUIZyFIwSxFOdg.text: They seriously have THE coolest set up & ambiance- but it ends there.  Food is overpriced.  Hardly any healthy options.  Servers were overloaded so it took forever to get anything.

ziOEtV1ziaH_lTkRgMmm2A.text: We visited on a Tuesday at lunch. The Cafe was mostly empty of customers as well as staff. A party of 11 was ahead of us and the hostess just disappeared. A man came out and took charge after a 20 minute wait and sat the large party. Ours was a party of 7, which for lunch is a bit large, however, this is a destination restaurant and should be able to handle the larger screen parties. We were finally seated after a total wait of 21 minutes. The waitress immediately addresses the table and took drink orders. Our orders were taken and we waited 45 minutes for food. The food was cold, taco shells were impossible to chew,cheese was congealed or melted and cooled several times. The biggest disappointment was the aquariums retrofitted with bubblers instead of fish. The tanks used to be an educational experience for my grandkids. I was able to teach them about water chemisty, natural biological filtration and tank cycling.  I'd say that in the last several years this cafe will no longer be where we entertain our grandchildren.

bKkM-BWfauzRannrfUOFhA.text: Love Rainforet Cafe and even though this isn't the most exciting location, it's still a great rainforest!!  The staff is really nice and the food is great. I wish they were a little more organized on the hostess situation. Instead of using the elephant booth at the front, you just kind of wait around the fish tanks not knowing what's going on. Other than that, you can't complain about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Really great atmosphere :)
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lots of fish!

l5lXx9MM-kP34p6rGsgHGA.text: Three stars for the atmosphere. Lines are long for no apparent reason, but it is really nice and exciting. Sometimes the kiddos get scared because of the life like sounds and animals in the "jungle", but they love it! I only go here for my kids because the food you can get at Applebee's for half the price. It's not awful food, it's just food you can buy in the freezer section and heat up at home. Also the bathrooms are disgusting. I understand being busy and understaffed, but there is no reason to be serving food and have a bathroom looking like that.

GGFaBsMkJJ7TgC7Vi644zw.text: I haven't been here in years. And today I remembered why... The food is garbage! I only ate it cause I was super hungry. But I must say. Their staff is very courteous and friendly!

x9v25fxmwtQPy9_gBV_S_A.text: Would have been a 1 star but our waitress was super nice. Basically the worst rainforest cafe we've been to. Empty yet still took 20 mins to get seated. Mixed up all my kids orders. My food, ordered last by 15 mins, came out first yet our server said it was all sitting under the warming lights.   Seriously...consider not coming here. You'll be disappointed.

20he2CPK1CwB0B8Qdwy7mg.text: Waited 30 minutes in line to be seated. Not a big deal right? It is when they seat you and there a many empty tables. Menu....pricey. must be really good right?  Mediocre at absolute best. Steak was stiff. Shrimp was rubbery. Ribs were way overcooked. Truly a disappointment. Server was nice. Atmosphere is nice. Will not be back.

wylEqjVZFOp2QzFgqczJBw.text: The Rainforest Cafe Tempe is awesome if you have a school group or birthday party.  I teach special education and visit this location at least once per year.  The staff takes my students around and teaches them about the various animals and locations in the restaurant.    The staff is so amazingly nice and always welcomes my group.    I typically am not a fan of Rainforest Cafe's because typically the food is just so so and the decor is the same at all the locations but this one is different because of the friendly and passionate staff.

SFaumFy-51OHqTXTOLIi5g.text: I like the atmosphere.  That's really what you pay for.  The thunderstorms and rain and fog... The food is OK.  Nothing to rave over and nothing to bellyache over.  Prices are a bit steep for what you get.  Service is average.

8Oy7JL0rtEorJZ5RjHLuNw.text: Okay first off, its a fun themed kids place to eat. You go for more than the food. Mainly to see the look on your kids face when the animals come to life. The aquariums are great as well. As for the food, I think it has improved in quality from previous times. The one drink I got was very weak, nearly no alcohol for 12 bucks, so I would complain about that. The food in general was tasty but 4 people ate for 125.00, bit expensive if you ask me. But again it's an experience. My advice for keeping it a bit cheaper would be to share a burger $10-$15. The kids meals are about $6, but the optional drink cup will cost you an additional $8. It adds up quick.

INICW1IZmLCSNjXyM1QnPg.text: If you are going for the food it is expensive and just ok.  But if going to see the little ones eyes light up and  them enjoy themselves then this is the place.   My granddaughter know this is special and loves it.

0uysnT8qJ-7azFOMoXEVfw.text: Stopped in for a drink before heading home. Took a seat in bar, waited for service, after 15 minutes got up and left. The place looked empty at 4:00 pm on a Thursday. I guess they don't need the business.

L5y3YYEWTqY8cgbL7pjirQ.text: Tha atomosphere at the Rainforest is delightful especially for a 7 year old's birthday. But it is pricey.... 2.99 for ice tea or soda.... Sandwhiches average $15...but what I thought was really cheesey was the .99 charge for a birthday cupcake  Really??? Come on.... Definite rip off!!!!! But for a special occasion it was worth it :)

St-LJQ-Ni-BFJMC-dT_1AA.text: It is a fun place to take kids but can be distracting for adults.  There are times when the animals move, rain comes down in one area as "lightning" flashes.  We had good service and the food portions were big.  The food was fine.    There are aquariums to look at while waiting for a meal.  It's a bit pricey for just a meal though not outrageous but if you want entertainment for the kids, the price isn't that bad.

tIa4PcPlCF1PnRRRlJKr6w.text: The Rainforest Cafe in Denver closed before my kids were born, so when we were in Scottsdale on vacation, I jumped at the chance to take them here.  They are 3 and 1 and their minds were BLOWN.  I was surprised at how empty it was so I want to write them a positive review in hopes that this place doesn't ever close like ours did!  The server was fantastic and was so kind to our kids.  I am docking one star because the food was not super high quality but it was fine.  Really you are there for the ambience and my kids loved it!

mUG4TMaFZ3f8vUJ2T4aOzw.text: The restaurant was fairly empty yet it took 21 minutes for our food to come. I got a big appetizer combo and it was dried out. It tasted like it was cooked hours earlier. For a$70 bill I wish I had gone to Johnny Rockets. Disappointed.

tbE8Gx07p8X7J4kw9MnXEA.text: This is a special place for the kids, if you want them to be entertained and not worry if they get a little loud and excited about something this is a great place to take them. The food is nothing special (think theme park quality and prices), but it really is a one of a kind place. The pressed penny machines are always a cool and cheap, $.51, souvenir, that should help you getting around spending money in the attached gift shop. They have a full bar, and the kids can get a kid friendly frozen drink in a special cup. Kids meals are about $6-$7, adults range from $15, for soup and salad combo, to $22-$30 for fish or seafood. I wouldn't go here for the food, but go for that look on yours kid's faces and the cool parent/grandparent title for taking them there!

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

t8MIhBhqnyQUHVWDocfu-g.text: Staff was friendly. Food was so so.. like bar food.. I think it would be entertaining for little ones but not a place for quality. .. NO FISH IN GIANT FISH TANKS.... Bubbling water and some "coral"...

43KcR8bXSqZkdUg_nf4LjQ.text: My daughter decided that she wanted to come to the Rainforest Cafe for her 11th Birthday. We arrived close to 5 pm on a week night and it wasn't very busy. The atmosphere was super fun and kept the kids busy looking around. We ordered an appetizer and the drinks first and received them pretty quickly.  The thunder storms reminded us of the Midwest. Our food arrived in a fair amount of time and we all left full. If you are looking for a fun place to eat with your kidos and are ok w some noise this is the place to go!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

JGmWHhhj3Mq037JB_uagEA.text: Great place for kids! The Cheetah-Rita drink is awesome! Prices are a little high but food is good. Great atmosphere. Took awhile for someone to come take our order.,

kVuJX1MAcH1GtKxNjYOrNA.text: Meh. Overpriced, sub-par food with some cheesy animatronics of gorillas and elephants. If you have kids I guess it's worth a one-time visit for the experience. But the place is noisy, the staff is not very attentive, and man the prices. You'll pay $15 for a hamburger- and that's probably the cheapest item on the menu. We walked out spending $75 for 2 adults and a toddler, which is just insane to me. You have to walk through the gift shop on the way out- more ways to spend money!!

yNRhyOUcOz_e3j0sVYQsRA.text: Sadly, this review doesn't address the food.....because we never made it far enough to try it. My wife, toddler, and I came in early afternoon on a Tuesday. There appeared to be ample staffing and plenty of seating, yet we waited in a line to be seated for a good 15-20 minutes. That should've been our signal to leave the Rainforest. Once given a table and menus, we then waited another 20 minutes.....no wait staff came by....not for water, not to greet us....nothing. Our 2 year old had reached her statute of limitations and we bailed.   Advice to management....when you have a pricey menu, and a niche atmosphere that caters to impatience kids (and parents), you better be sharp with the service experience. Shame on the manager for not being more observant and holding his staff to a higher standard.

NZJu_2XCtaMMC99ORvyygw.text: Where do I begin? 15 min and no one even acknowledged us. I can understand if the place was packed, but there was like 20 empty tables! And that was just in my vision area. Four waiters passed us by never asked if we've been helped or anything, and this is that we were even looking around trying to find someone. We finally got up and left and told the hostess, I asked for the manager and all he said was sorry and offered a free appetizer if we stayed. Uh, ya ok, let me wait an hour for that. No.

yF9sK-oxNVqU3Tt6pKLnUg.text: Food was pretty good but the prices are HIGH and it's so loud. Scared my 2 year old every time it started storming (every 15 min or so).  Place is loud in general due to waterfall.

3kq6bDoEorNFALNpqo9ajQ.text: This is a fun place for kids and that's the only positive thing I can say. Service was slow. Food is without flavor and $17.49 for a Cobb salad?? No thank you. I will never go back.

GuSWFSV9ZIAT2l8Flx6qBw.text: Wow...bad food and way overpriced.  Will never be coming back. Got a burger....figured that was a sure thing.  Not. Would have rather had a burger at McDonald's. Charged my 12 year daughter $3.29 for a drink and $15 for my untasty burger. Yikes! Slow service too.

Sbn4ZGK1J_wwAaaarTUG3A.text: I am sad to report that their sampler platter has shrunk in size. Now they call it an appetizer platter and it's still the same price but they took away the shrimp skewers. Maybe they weren't popular with other people?? but I love my coconut shrimp on a stick. They took away the ribs (I think?) and replaced it with some dry breaded chicken. However, the best thing about the appetizer platter is the southwestern eggrolls. Also, the artichoke and spinach dip is super good just the bowl they give the dip in is a tad smaller too. That's why I'm giving you Rainforest Cafe only three stars. Boo!

TqPWP6yKQK7mtPud-3254Q.text: Service was good,but food wasn't. It was rushed and the chicken was pretty dry we also had to return the plate because the chicken was burnt. It's a nice place to see the animals and how it's designed and the store but the food was rushed and not so good.

EB7X1mc7IslOJ2PBmKehww.text: The service here is so slow I'm not hungry any more. I won't be back any time soon. For what they offer I'd rather go eat at a Village Inn No one even came by to let us know there was a problem.

yxShu6h92_jdDk0NOkxXJQ.text: I would say the food isn't as great as it use to be but it's so fun for the kids that it makes it worth it. Kids love the cups and the environment, just seeing their faces light up every time the storm goes off is great. It is definitely worth it for a kids birthday, and that's when we do it. Def a great spot for a family dinner. I always enjoy it.

dK-V3rC6mlYKRBc8Jqt4Lg.text: I think we all know you don't come here for the food.  It's overpriced and fairly basic.  You come for the experience.  The animatronics, the storm in the jungle, and it's kitschy.  The waitress, she was tops and is the reason for the stars.  It was the being seated aspect that was ridiculous.  Handed a piece of paper and told to come back in 30 minutes.  15 minutes in, we see them seating people who came in after.  Then we're told we can get in line to be seated.  It was just poorly organized and no one really seemed to know what they were doing.  And not once did anyone say sorry for the wait or seem to care.  Like I said, food is eh, it's more for kids in my opinion, and your service may be okay or not.

BTA0k5movBRZLgRJX30lkw.text: My boyfriend and I went to go get drinks at the bar. There were two bartenders at the front cleaning and we sat in the back. We waited for about 5 min no one greeted so we decided to move up closer cause we thought maybe they didn't see us. This time again still waited for over 5 min and not one person acknowledged us. They even looked at us too and didn't even say "we will be right with you". We overheard them and they were having a social conversation instead with other coworkers. So we got up and left.

dyVx5ClPRtRd46Va1n86JQ.text: I loved the atmosphere and everything! It was a very fun place... my boyfriends pasta was awesome and our server, Daniela was AMAZING. She was very kind and bubbly! I will definitely come again :)

eUuWSFJNQIbupFvaNWvpTQ.text: This review is for alissa my waitress from yesterdays lunch. She is AMAZING!! She was on point with every th hing and genuinely kind !me and my and my son loved her and we will come back to see her. Also the nachos are huge and delicious! Dont order hamburgers with it  hahaha

i2Pk_BhsszssmLdmLJ82tA.text: (Mental note - its a hard line to post poor reviews, hence the pending draft for 4 months)  There were literally 10 reviews I could have copied and pasted about the poor food, over priced food and slow service. The only thing I can add is INFLEXIBLE.   I ordered the fish tacos and not only were they $17.99 (which is a far cry for fairly prices). Literally not customizable what so ever. As most Arizona's would appreciate asked for a salad in lieu of rice and beans which came to shock would cost me an additional fee if $4. No im not kidding. So now my super average meal transformed into unreasonable not to mention disgusting. My now weak tacos accompanied by gallons of mayo in tasteless ranch on my $4 salad just tipped the tables  We don't be back, pathetic and poorly managed. There's no experience or atsmophere other than the zoo that would i frequent and pay money for with such underwhelming result. Buh bye Rainforest.

Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Side salad
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp Basket

EE4ZQ-_XUhzc7kj8ihdGEQ.text: I don't know what was worse, the mediocre and over-priced food, or the terrible service. My little guy turned five so we went for lunch. I was pretty shocked by prices. Once I justified the prices based on the fact it's in a mall, I hoped the food would be good. The food was terrible. Our food spent a fair amount of time under a heat lamp. I worked in the restaurant for years so I can identify heat lamped food. Our server was awkward when he came around which wasn't often. We asked for a few things when the food came, none of which we ever got. The animatronic animals are cool, but I recommend watching from out in the mall.

gO-mjA5Qj9SRG4Th03LvSA.text: I have no idea why people are complaining about the food and price, this restaurant is meant to be an experience!! If you want a good burger go to a good burger place. If you want a good salad go to a good salad place. If you want a fun experience go to rainforest cafe! We loved it and the Cobb salad was actually very tasty!!

FDu9QVJWs1LoyYshJFThfQ.text: The only reason I would come here is for the experience for my kids. The waiter we had called us vague with our order when we asked for a simple root-beer and water. He never introduced himself and hardly made an appearance during our visit, nor did he ask how our food was. Speaking of food, our appetizer was cold when we got it. But how can you say anything when the service is so poor. And it was hardly busy! Their prices and customer service is not worth it at all!

I3hS_bF3O1vIxSuAReSqWQ.text: So this place has gone downhill. The only cool thing here is the decor and when the animals start talking. This restaurant use to be a happening  place and you had to wait to be seated. Not anymore!  The hostess was rude and lazy. We were seated near the bathroom entrance even though there were plenty of tables available. It took 10 minutes for our server just to greet us them Another 10 minutes to get our drinks. We actually received our appetizer before our drinks. Food was just okay. It lacked flavor. I went with the chicken fried chicken and they forgot my potatoes. My server was MIA most of the time and I had to find another server to help me get a box and the bill. I was so sad to see this place go to the Pitts. It is a fun place to come visit if you are out of town to see the decor but that is it.   By the way Bathrooms were so dirty and disgusting.

Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Alcohol free drinks
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. What happened to the fun cool restaurant?

wUbbtdY-L3WWGV0GOymwaQ.text: The food was okay  I didn't go here with high expectations !   My kids loved it tho and the atmosphere is perfect for the little humans !   Last time I went to rainforest cafe was over 15 yrs ago . So I was happy to experience it with my kids !   Service was standard and like I said we don't come for the food we came for the experience .

Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The menu

JfaKvlgVK-M9IQwoxxYNDQ.text: Went here for a birthday dinner and I actually was really impressed... haven't been here for a really long time and I am glad I gave it another try.. I got the mediterranean chicken Panini and Caribbean rice, Blue mountain chicken sandwich, fish tacos and a kids dinosaur chicken with mashed potatoes..  everything was good and the service was great!

u9SQ4KafLgdrrTo4toLg3A.text: The food is blah at best and overpriced for what you get. The story however is that my wife and daughter got food poisoning from the Nachos they ate. I called the next day and talked to the manager and she said she would talk to the General Manager and he was to call me. No one called!  Called the next day and reminded them about calling me and once again they said the GM would call. No o e called again. Never going there again, they don't care about their customers.

tpF7A78y9bACiEYF8LJrCw.text: Dino nuggets tasted like bad dog food.  Check your kids meal before letting them eat.  Ick  My burger was ok.  BBQ sauce kept it from being too dry, otherwise it would have been blah.  Still nice decorations really for the kids.  They have birthday cupcakes if it is your kid's birthday, they charge 99cents for them.

K3d4umgL2ZghmyU9DMy59w.text: Terrible service!!!!!! Took forever for a server to come to our table, and food took a little over an hour. We got our appetizer last which was weird. They didn't seem to know their table numbers as servers brought out food several times asking if it was ours(which it wasn't). very disappointing. Asked for share plates never got them. Asked for a to go box and also never received one.   Also thought it was weird our server took our check after we signed it right away and we're still seated.   Doesn't seem like there is much training and way overpriced. Would not come back save your money

0f41W1hXNRl3k2gnTmzvrw.text: The three stars are for service. The hostess was nice and seated us right away. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. The food however, was not that great especially for the price. The ambience does not make up for it. The women's restroom was dirty and the entire countertops were soaking wet. We will not be returning to rainforest cafe.

x3_VK_RHlTcg52pJ0FP8yw.text: One of the worse servie we got. Order a Mojito with souvenir glass. Waiter come back says does not come with it. Showed her menu again says it does. Then she disappear for like 10 min and was suppose to take our food order 3 times. We are just sitting there waiting for drinks still. Then she comes back with drinks. Still no food order.

8KefIGvOCp1IPnuCZCmGfQ.text: This is a nice restaurant. The food is good but the restaurant is pricey. $30 a person. Food is around $20

fmVc2xI7wnb4MU768duK5g.text: Overall great experience.Love the view inside as if you're looking at the stars and clouds and the waterfall is amazing!! Fantastic food we had the ahi poke tower and Rasta pasta.Both were delicious and the tuna was so fresh!!A bit pricey but def worth it.

lYjoSNo3kFuXwl2IqInN-A.text: Atmosphere is amazing I can say the burgers are great the pastalaya is to DIE FOR SUPER YUMMY
