Ff6Bc6mdNieOzR67ILRA0A.text: I took my niece and nephew here for dinner. Thank goodness for places like this, the robot animals and storm that happens every now and then really kept them entertained. The food wasn't amazing, but it was good enough for a theme chain place. They actually have some pretty good drinks for adults too.  The service was a little slow, but I couldn't complain too much since the atmosphere was really keeping the kids happy and fascinated - giving us time to talk and actually eat.  Of course you end up spending money in the gift shop, but I think it really gives kids an experience that they enjoy and they have enough choices on the menu that you don't feel like you are sacrificing too much.  This location is inside the mall, so parking can be a bear if you aren't planning to visit the mall as well as the cafe.

aBWThacVCDpMsCmWykH6ig.text: Messy set up- thought I was in line to be seated... no I was in line for the baby stroller drop off.  After getting out of that clearly unmarked line I stepped into the actual wait to be seated line.  The waiters and waitresses were dressed in safari gear which fit with the rain forest theme.  The restaurant is dimmed  so you can see the small star display on the ceiling and the trees are lit up with fish tanks randomly placed around the interior.  Personally I thought the menu was very over priced for the generic food that was served. I tried to play it safe with a cheese burger and chips and that ended up to be $15.00.  Burger was dry and the bun was greasy.  The chips were tasty though kettle cooked.    I had my hopes on going to this establishment but I just wasn't pleased. I think more exotic food items and semi lower prices or even a happy hour sort or menu would be a great idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

4JoAKvvcyOSi1HIjWb0UtQ.text: Worst Rain Forest experience we've ever had. This is our 3rd location thay we've visited. The service was SO SO slow.  We are Landry's members. Normally we are treated very well, seated and served quickly. Not this time. We waited for a good 15 minutes while there were TONS of empty tables. Our waitress didn't take our drink order for 10 minutes. The manager stopped by to thank us for being members and said he would be back later to check on everything. He never came, which was probably for the better because he would have gotten an ear ful.   Food was so so, had to ask for refills, asked for a to go box which we never got. Our waitress brought us someone else's card back. It was just not a good deal.  Won't be returning to this location.

q8ylfhySQP3qz8dw-4FfQg.text: My husband and I came to the Rainforest Cafe for our only day off of work. We planned for a relaxing meal, a fun time at the aquarium and a nice movie to end the day. Unfortunately, to start off our day, I ended up finding a long white hair in my fish. Gross, I know. The manager (I'm assuming) didn't really seem to know what to do and frankly didn't seem to care as he didn't say much. Granted, he did offer a replacement meal and we weren't even sure if we were going to get a discount or something but the waitress (Anisabel) made it all better. She sincerely expressed how sorry she was and surprised us by taking the my whole meal off our check. I was about to be completely livid about the whole situation but Anisabel had given us such superior customer service that I couldn't help but leave content with how the situation was handled. Off to an adventurous day we go!

ukZTL2eQQo0FXRiDXlz3tg.text: What a ripoff and poorly run restaurant. We can forgive the 20 minute wait to force you to shop in the gift shop. Then you can't sit near any animated characters because they are "slammed" but we can see plenty of open tables....translation...their staff can't handle a busy restaurant. We wait 45 minutes after ordering 2 salads,1 pasta dish and a child's menu item.  One visit by server in 45 minutes, and that was just to take order and deliver iced tea.  We ask a passing server to alert the manager who says " sorry...you are welcome to leave."  Poorly run restaurant. 65 minutes after we enter and we leave without eating. We won't be back!

oe2yIuDRJI4GdPrg750PhA.text: Entertaining if you have little ones - but slightly overpriced because of that.    Service was attentive but but a bit slow.  They appeared a little short staffed (they close at 6pm on Sundays and had a decent crowd in there right up to close).  I had the ribs - not bad.  Beer was cold; decent options for kids.

1NwLiFQ7JTzTeABS0czKig.text: No wonder this is low rated. Came in as we haven't been in a long while thought it would be a good place for the kids.  This place is old dusty and smells bad inside. We sat for 20 minutes without anyone coming to our Table and after two inquiries if we had a server.  One person said I'm sure someone will be with you and the other one came when we were leaving.  Talked to Tom the GM and he didn't seem too surprised.  When we walked in one of the hosts said let them sit wherever we have servers standing around doing nothing.  Wow - last try - this place has gone down - very sad - needs an entire revamp - Landry's - what happened?!

8IcTBVLJUqWIiOX80nBDFQ.text: I HATE the new menu. Makes me never want to come back. It's all about the money and that's clearly why they changed and menu.

6GxcWqMRGw3w2IDFqTgXqg.text: I took my grandkids there last week and they loved it!  The food I thought was good for the price and the kids ate everything.  The best part of our whole experience was the face painter that was there, the kids absolutely loved her and what a great job she did.  We will definitely be back.....

bsg1lv2XuRM2Ji1cNvMFDg.text: The youngest of my two kiddos had a birthday with our family it is your day you pick all we do. He chose Rain Forest cafe . So I award 3 stars for ambiance and kid fun factor. That is the only reason for one star. The service not so good, only checked on us 3 times, and looked annoyed. All cafes should be about the food on that note the food was horrible. The bacon BBQ burger was drowning in BBQ sauce, And cool to the touch. There was so much sauce the bread was soggy. 13.99 for a lunch meat filled turkey sandwich slopped with mayo. Kids hot dog again like warm at best and not kosher dare I say bar S? My other son had Mac n cheese again cold temperature. They charged .99 for a birthday cupcake I didn't ask for. Should a 5 year olds one person sized cupcake be free? This place is expensive and not worth half of what they charged, sorry to be harsh...but ugh! Not good.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

XYEz-YyypuYhhK-D1sP3Tg.text: I'm very particular about where I eat and I usually cook most of my meals at home if possible since the majority of family friendly restaurants are just OK.  However, I was pleasantly surprised with the food we ate at Rainforest Cafe yesterday.  I ordered Mac and Cheese for my daughter and was expecting something that came out of a blue box, but no, it was actually homemade pasta and cheese.  It was just like something I would make her at home!  We also ordered foccacia bread (not on the menu but costs .99  for two good sized portions).  It was sooo good.  Again, I was expecting a premade hard piece of bread but this was warm, frehsly baked bread with the right amount of garlic and seasonings to give it flavor.  As an entree a friend and I split the fried shrimp platter.  It was pretty good!  Everything was fried to perfection and didn't taste like it had been cooked in dirty oil (I can't stand when restaurants make fries in dirty oil and you can taste it!  So disgusting!).  An added bonus to the good food was the entertainment for the kids!  I'll definitely be back since my expectations were exceeded at Rainforest Cafe!

XkflhCLeMw-t7Clfs7kanw.text: I thought the place was pretty cool. There only thing I'll say that they should do is not have the extremely loud thunder and lightning effect with all the animals going crazy all at once happen every minute. Lol The food was very good, the drinks were good, and the staff was very friendly. A little expensive, but very good.

rsoODtT12F8xflsLWCrFeQ.text: Wow, this place has gone super downhill.  Prices have gone up, menu choices decreased and food was poor quality! Service was horrible and it took forever to get food. Management never followed up on the complaint. Used to love going to this restaurant,  various locations, but after this experience, won't be back and will make sure all friends and family know too!

TIR3zDUZKo1vaMY0HX5R5A.text: Great place to bring your kids. The moving animals and special effects will keep your kids entranced. The menu has some good choices for adults and a kids menu.

mahMnnvyo5b8io7XbIDG-w.text: Guacamole Burger is good, as well as Tomato Basil soup. The kids ordered off of kid's menu. The food they receive is just ok. I am not impressed with the quality they serve to the kids. Having said that, they enjoyed themselves.  Beware of the lightning storm that occurs every so often. My 2.5 year old was afraid.  My bill came to 47.00 total (with tip), for 1 adult and 3 children.

JXeHGH8Oj1zB0r4TKQeT2g.text: As expensive as this place is, the food was mediocre.  2 stars on the food, 3 stars for the service.    I got the Rainforest Burger with cheese and it was something that I could make and I have never made a burger in my life.  Flimsy on the fries, too.  Hubby got the turkey wrap with tomato basil soup.  The soup tasted like marinara sauce and the hubby said he was glad the waiter got his order wrong by only giving him half the turkey wrap.  He's usually easy to please.  My daughter barely had 2 bites of her mac/cheese.  Frame of reference: she devours the mac/cheese at Paradise Bakery  On the up side my daughter was entertained with all the sights and sounds.  The decor and ambience is fun for kids.  She really enjoyed the "experience" but I don't think we'd ever come here again.  Our meal ended up being $49 but that's with 15% gratuity and two drinks, too.  Pricey for a mediocre meal.  Come here for the ambience but don't expect much from the quality of food.  Meh, I've had better.  I really should've given this place 2 stars but I'm feeling generous today.

zjtAnPIPI1FbfS0n9cGsqA.text: Waited at our table for over 15 minutes without being greeted. Got tired of waiting because we were starving. As we were walking out a server said to us "Oh man I'm so sorry! I didn't even see you guys at my table." And that's about all he offered to the situation. So yea... we won't be going back.

CfXEQXcEJmDLNz6yobIhxQ.text: Really enjoyed going here with the kids! I have not been here since I was a kid and it was great! My 8 year old and 5 year old loved the whole meal. Just like many other reviews I will say the service was slow but we were busy socializing which made time go by fast. They also had great prices for kids meals and even kids cups. I do think the adult prices are a bit much but you do get lots of food. Not a bad place for lunch.

h4g3Ie6A_dwKxmMi5gukqA.text: Great place to go as a family. Menu prices are a bit high, but you pay for your experience. Tina was our server and she was great. She was very attentive and provided great service. My husband and I ordered the beastly burger and shared it. I would definitely recommend sharing, the burger was huge!!! The burger was salty, but I myself enjoy things on the salty side so it was perfect. Overall, this is a great place to come for special family outings.

bFH1cLPt0NsK78V3bzAutg.text: Loved it here great food great servers and the place. Makes it fun for the kids ,my kids loved there mac n cheese .and i ordered jambalaya it was so good!!4 star will reccomnd this place

GxUKLO2NgccZwM48dP_Z-Q.text: Hadn't been here in years.  Went on Labor Day around noon.  Got a great/clean table right away.  I had forgotten how noisey the place was. I believe the animal/sound effects level could have been lowered in conjunction with the smaller crowd.  Other than that, us adults really enjoyed my salads.  The kids enjoyed their food too, except one of them didn't like their spaghetti because it came out as macaroni with tomato sauce.  (The server said it was spiral pasta - and it was not.)  But without a hesitation, the server brought the child a Mac & Cheese, and she liked that just fine.  They offered a special juice bottle/snack holder combo for the kid's meal drink that's included...BEWARE that thing is $9.00 !  Quite the pricey upgrade - cost more than the whole kid's meal. It's a bit excessive.  In fact, the salads were quite overpriced as well. $18.00 each.  If a consumer is looking to pay more than necessary (even if it's for much better food than I ever had in the past,) just to sit and be not-dazzled by hooting monkeys/blaring elephant robotics every 5 mins or so - then go right ahead. Treat yourself.  I'll keep this place in reserve for only very rare/special occasions.

Kovc1xmHplIeRB6sbRicHQ.text: We were given a wait card and told to come back in 30 minutes even though most of the tables were empty.  When we did get seated, our server was very nice. We had to wait about 30 minutes after ordering for our food which when we got it, we were not very impressed. I ordered a strawberry daiquiri, I tasted ZERO alcohol.   The food is comparable to Applebee's with Red Lobster's pricing. Our bill was $100 and with that, we may have been happier at Red Lobster or even Applebee's but we just accepted that eating there is purely for the experience of our kids. The lights, sounds and decorations were an interesting show but definitely a one and done type of experience.

OlWpQ7GGHAZWz4QiIbYK-g.text: Perhaps we went on a bad day but we had a horrible experience. I was taking my daughter out for a daddy - daughter day lunch and decided Rainforest Cafe would be a fun experience. Upon arriving at the hostess station we were informed there was a wait and she gave us a card with a time she wrote on to come back. This was a bit surprising considering at least half the tables were empty. The time she gave us was 11:45. I checked the time on my phone and it was 11:42 which i found rather amusing. We perused the gift shop for 3 minutes and then came back at the appointed time and were seated.   We looked at our menus and quickly made our selections and then I was playing tic tac toe with my daughter and the crayons and activity book provided. We waited a long time and nobody came, not even to bring us water. By 12:05 (20 minutes) and still we hadn't been acknowledged I asked my daughter if she wished to leave and she said she was starving so we decided to go to the food court. I figured if they were that slow in taking our order our food would be probably an hour or more. I looked around and other diners appeared to be in the same predicament so we just got up and walked out. Never again.

SL5E-KnME-BLYcCsylMPww.text: If I could give 0 stars I would...  I have no idea what was going on the other night but the place was about empty and I walked up with 3 other people and stood in line for about 10 minutes and nobody came to seat us. I walk over to a one of the employees and asked if she could seat us and she looked at me and mumbled something under her breath and walked away. I was really confused on what was even going on. My boyfriend suggested we stand a wait a little longer until the rest of the party arrives. About 5 minutes later, she seats us. There was probably 3 other families there and it took about an hour for our food to arrive... service was just horrible.. the food is WAY overpriced. A simple chicken strip basket was 20 dollars! Very disappointed. I don't think I'll ever come back. It's a shame because the environment is really cool.

czY-j0gcNB6tk3PoCAp7hQ.text: Average food, decent atmosphere, overpriced food.  Not much more to say than that.  Nothing has changed since this place was brought to the valley many moons ago. It's hard to rationalize their price point for older Disneyland like vibe.   My daughter thought it was pretty neat given the decor but of course she didn't get stuck with an $80 tab for two adults and a child.  Would I go again, no, but I could see why a tourist would want to give it a try. Not for me.

Sp9JNu4o3w-Us_xH0f-BTA.text: We come for the kitsch not the kitchen!  ;-)   Have been coming here since it opened at least once a year.  When the kiddos were born we started coming a little more often. It's a pricey outing and the ambiance and service is the reason for our coming back.  Don't get me wrong, they make a great burger but at $14 it's the most expensive I think I ever had. My wife and I usually split one and after tip it's still a $50 experience after feeding 2 kids as well. I think if their pricing was more in line with other restaurants we would visit even more. I found the other dishes to be mediocre at best so I stick with the burger now each time.  Every 15 minutes there is a thunderstorm and all the animals freak out. It's really cute but VERY little kids may find it a bit scary. Mine used to but now at ages 7 and 10 they absolutely love it.  In conclusion it's a really fun restaurant but VERY expensive and the food is only so so.. service has been fantastic every visit so tip well! Those poor servers go through 30+ thunderstorms in a full day's work!

tEXx1Q3xGQgYmGGmK5kDmQ.text: We had an awesome EXPERIENCE yesterday!!!! Ignore all of the whiners who complain about this or that, especially the cost. You can go to another restaurant and POSSIBLY pay a couple bucks less, but you will not leave that restaurant with the same LIFETIME MEMORIES that you will leave with when you leave Rainforest Cafe!!! Be sure to take some pictures!!!  They offer so MANY choices on the kid's menu, including dinosaur shaped chicken, shrimp, grilled chicken, hot dogs, burgers, grilled cheese, chicken quesadilla, mac and cheese, spaghetti AND pizza! The kids can circle the picture of their choice on top, circle a the picture of their side choice and then circle their drink choice. The menu is careful not to make it obvious that sodas are an option for a drink. It is in small print and kids might not notice. If soda is okay with you, just know it is an option. The same goes for French fries and mac and cheese as sides. They offer the healthy options in pictures. My kid was disappointed to later note that fries were an option. Next time we know.   Our server, Christalyn, was SPOT ON!!! She is a very attentive and efficient server!! When I asked for extra lemon, she brought enough the first time! That is so rare!! When I ask for LOTS of lemon, never does the server bring enough, usually just two slivers. My kid likes to drown his chicken and shrimp in lemon. He ordered the Shrimpkens which is popcorn shrimp and dinosaur shaped chicken nuggets!! He LOVED his food!!! It was fun AND tasty!!  We LOVED the experience 100%!!! Rare that we give a dining experience 100%!! There is so much love that is put into creating this special spot!! From the gorillas who come to life, to the elephants that come to life, to the inside large wall waterfall, to the thunderstorms, to the butterfly to the amazing attention to detail, this place DELIVERS on ALL LEVELS!! On our way out, we were all literally pointing out different things that we didn't notice on the way in!! It took us a while to get out as we were so in awe with so many things to observe!! Basically EVERY INCH from floor to ceiling is covered in interesting decor!! Even the TABLES and the BOOTHS are covered in interesting jungle related materials! It is a mini retreat from reality!!  Our food was hot, fresh and did NOT disappoint!! We ordered the onion rings and they were tasty!! It came with ranch dip and another dip. I was eating the red spicy ketchup type dip (not sure what it was) with my fork as it was unique and tasty!! I ordered fried fish and French fries. I have honestly had better fried fish, but there fried fish was very good!! No complaints from me!! I would order it again. The tarter sauce was good and the fries were skin on, hot, fresh and awesome!!   Ignore the whiners and give this place a try!! You might just decide that you are going to eat there as often as we plan to do so!! We have already made a plan to return this weekend and bring friends along!!

ii_1d8E_u5IWktPSkjgCtA.text: The Rainforest Cafe is so nostalgic! I was visiting Phoenix with some time to kill at the mall so I figured why not indulge in some tropical drinking & faux rain storms. The location is basically the same as any other with lots of plastic animals and fun gimmicks. I sat at the bar and was easily able to find a spot. I adored their animal themed bar stools.   To start I had the featured Mule. It was packed with just enough liquor and I liked the fruity touch. For food I had the fish & chips, which was actually really good. I wasn't expecting much, but the breading was very flavorful and crunchy. I also enjoyed the large portion size.  Overall this place is great for a few drinks being hectic shopping, but it is overpriced for what you get. I think the next time I'll be back is actually with some children.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fish &amp; chips

CRzU-5Kg5X8k7XpqPi5ThQ.text: Weekday lunch visit review.  Took my 3.5 year old here that cannot have gluten.  Staff was great - baked french fries (vs fried) for her and made sure everything on the plate was gluten free.  The food was yummy (we shared a burger).  It was juicy and delicious.  Service was friendly and the atmosphere was super cool.  Best part - it was truly gluten free because my kid didn't get sick right after eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

d_OLAKoIxSOERegXEEgnAQ.text: Overall this wasn't a great experience. We went at a slow time before the noon lunch rush. The place did not appear busy. We were promptly seated by a very nice hostess. We were greeted by Jason, our server, who did a good job taking care of us. The table, chairs, and high chair were all clean. Drinks were brought promptly. However, my fork and spare plate (see pictures) were dirty. Fajitas were good and filling. Wait time for food was long and dishes did not come out at same time for everyone. Price was expensive, but not ridiculous considering the cool experience and quality of food. All in all, I will probably be back because the kids love it.

_wPcdbDFzlsaCzMjz3YrIA.text: All I know is my kids love it here. That's all that matters to me :) family friendly and super cute atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

Jb8mh8sonOWY9BSczNKsGA.text: Overpriced, overdone, and overbearing. I thought the service was good, but it was pricey for the quality of the food. The Rainforest Burger was $14.49, it was good, but not great. I could have gotten a better burger at Village Inn. I will say this about the staff though, they were friendly and everyone that worked the tables was hustling. The dining areas were clean and there was sort of a Disneyland feel to the atmosphere.  Kids would love this place for the decor and the campy/gimmicky environment, but it's not what I would consider a relaxing place to spend an afternoon. The music was really loud (and I mean really LOUD), but that was offset by the annoying animal noises that was integrated into the crappy sound system. It's supposed to be a rain forest, yes, I get it...need animal noises to complete the illusion, but does the soundtrack have to drown out all conversation? The only thing missing were members of an indigenous South American tribe trying to shoot curare-dipped darts into the necks of every patron trying to munch down their meal in peace.  We skipped dessert because of the loud music and couldn't get out of there fast enough. I bet there's a high turnover with the staff; from their perspective, I couldn't imagine spending more than 4 hours in there without suffering from permanent hearing loss or wishing there was a curare dart around for some relief.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Rainforest Burger - meh...

PbrxkplogHb-uwjFjyUC5A.text: I use to love this place. I am not sure what happened to it. We went during the week for lunch and there were a ton of open tables, but had to wait 20 minutes before we could be seated.   The hostess gave me a card with the time to return. My kids really wanted to eat there and I told them we would, otherwise I would have eaten anywhere else. I would have chosen the mexican restaurant across the way, but I promised my kids. They love it there.  Once we were seated the server seemed like we were annoying here just being there. The table was dirty and there was stuff all over the floor. I had to ask the server if they could wipe down the table.  Service was slow and so was the food coming out. We were never checked on and I had to ask another service if we could get a refill on our drinks. I hate that it has gone down hill so badly in the last few years. I feel like the service, lack of food, and quality has not been the same. I really hope they turn it around since it is a great restaurant inside. I would hate for it to close.   Even though we live in Tucson anytime we pass through Phoenix or there visiting my kids always ask to go there. So we go a few times a year.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kids menu

cjffVOrUehkwPLsBt_h8ag.text: Went today to celebrate my birthday at the Arizona Mills Mall location. Previously we had visited the Orlando location while on vacation and had a wonderful experience. The Arizona location was a much different experience. We were seated at 'table 8' which is located just outside the restroom. I explained we had driven an hour to get here and celebrate my birthday, was there another table available- we were told no and that it would be an hour wait if we did not accept this table- fine we accepted the table. Apparently 3 large travel buses unloaded just prior to our arrival and they were the service priority. We had to ask for napkins and table ware and no way could we get drink refills. Food was just bad. Tasted like mayonnaise on the chicken tacos- yuck !!  ONE AND DONE, will not be back.

TaUCNaivuBkDiRR_Fnd7jg.text: My sister brought me and my son here for lunch one day during the week. I had never been here, but she had on several occasions; so I knew I was already missing out on something. I thought the whole atmosphere of the "rainforest" was so cool! Everywhere you looked it was beautifully setup, there were animals, and stars that lit up the ceiling. Then every once in awhile thunder and rain sounded and the lighting changed which I thought was pretty impressive because it was interactive dining.  Their food was yummy as well. We had a chicken pasta which we split because their portions are really good big sizes. And for an appetizer we had this fresh tuna with chips. That was so good because it was served with mango and other fresh fruit which really infused the flavors! It was very good. Also, they have a bar, for the adults, and the bar stools are various animals!!! That is so cool!!! I think this is a great setting for family dining or fun dining! Everyone should visit. :)

alvpy4aIWKWlpAQAfRV1cg.text: Came on a Friday evening and had a great experience - even with our two rambunctious little ones! No wait at all. Service and food were great! The rainforest, moving animals, lighting, and sounds are exciting and entertaining for the kiddos.   Nice selection of kids menu options. Hubby and I ordered the appetizer sampler and a shrimp and salmon dish on their specials menu to split. It was ample food and nice to taste a bunch of different things.   It's so nice to be able to go out to eat at a truly kid-friendly restaurant and get decent food options. We'll definitely return!

-0LTZd_GXxf20wSX8Nt5rQ.text: If I could give this location zero stars, I would. The server was great, but the wait time for food is ridiculous! Then when I received my"panini" it wasn't cooked... I mean uncooked chicken...cold...chicken. They took it back while the rest of my family ate their meal. By the time they brought my food back everyone was done (20minutes later).  I told them to wrap it to go. They did comp the sandwich, but when I got home to eat it it was terrible. The chicken was clearly microwaved and drier than the Sahara. Will never go back

7NJB2VV-RFwahtsDa1fwiw.text: Great onion ring appetizer -great flavor, quantity and size! Fajitas- my husband said that he would do only chicken next time as the beef was a little tough. It was slightly overpriced for the amount of meat they gave. The tortillas were good and soft, and the chicken had good flavor! The rice was decent but somewhat bland. The guacamole was good.   Rasta Pasta- excellent flavor and great amount! The garlic toast was a bit too oily and salty for my taste but was still good. Probably only a couple dollars overpriced.   Service- really great customer service!!! Anissa belle (Annie) did an amazing job! The great teamwork ensured that our food was delivered on time and pipping hot, and that our drinks were constantly refilled.   All in all, we had a wonderful time and enjoyed the entire experience! We'll definitely go again.

dC3Pu8snDptV5XYDfnkFbA.text: Our meals were very good!  And pretty generous as well. I got the fish and chips and my husband got fish tacos. He also got the coffee and said it is very good! Coming from Mr.  "Picky" that's is a real compliment!! my only complaints are that the prices are too high for us on a regular basis and they would not allow a substitute for Cole slaw which I do not like.

photos.caption: Photo of Rainforest Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

d7hJSq8vaym0DNk_KrfisQ.text: Food was cold. WAYYYYYY over priced. Waited for a while to actually get our drink order taken.. then everything after that was just as long if not longer.. we were there and didn't complain but the frustration was noticed and they gave us a 10% discount.. first time over ever gotten 10%.. most give you the appetizer for free.. this was a perfect storm for a negative review...

hq7d7hMGeLgFKPg4svMZjQ.text: I was a hotel restaurant manager for twenty years, and this location's staffing and food were appalling. You can't blame the clueless young people who work there, as it was obvious that they've had  zero training.  This mess falls squarely on the shoulders of lazy and incompetent management....in both the front and back of the house.  I frankly didn't want to sit down in this restaurant, as it reminded me of a seedy, darkened movie theater where heaven only knows what's crawling on the floor and presumably on everything else. We were seated in a booth at a sticky table, and sure enough, there were food remnants on the greasy seats; even an entire half of what looked like a very ancient grilled cheese sandwich. I would've left had it not been for my granddaughter, who was thrilled at seeing the elephants. (hence, the 1 star)  We waited forever to be greeted by a server, even though at 5 p.m. there were only 3 other parties seated; one party of 5 children and 2 adults, and two parties of 2.  If the front of the house is this bad, then you have to wonder if the kitchen management is equally lacking. Guess what? It is. I thought it'd be safe to order a salad. Think again! The lettuce was warm and limp and sitting in puddle of watery dressing w/ zero flavor. I would bet my life that the chicken, which topped the 'salad', came from a can; slithery, rubbery and with a sickening, plastic sheen.  I actually shuddered when I saw it. If you can't grill a chicken breast - please take it OFF the menu.  This place needs an overhaul, big time.

bLz8-T6MFhyPuQ0C97gsqA.text: It has been a number of years since I have been to the Rainforest Cafe, but I had really enjoyed my previous visits to 3 different locations (including Tempe). Yesterday, we went for a late lunch. We were seated quickly and had very attentive waitress. However, our main entrees took over 40 minutes to arrive. When it arrived, the pasta with shrimp was lukewarm and tasted old. My cheeseburger looked like the bun was run over or had been some kind of battle. These two entrees with a cheese dip appetizer cost about $60 before tip. Very expensive for disappointing food.

4trVYBknTzNDXdwiJJWTUg.text: Terrible! My fish taco was light on the fish and had a chewy tough tortilla. My wife had a piece of chicken that was chewy like rubber. Ml79W0mfCSUqJO1Ta8unqA.text: really convenient when you are starving after hours of shopping. the decor is great. its a great restaurant for kids because there is so much to look at. it is a bit loud though making it hard to talk to whoever you are with. the food is good. the fries were amazing! i love that they were thinly cut. service was good. they even have a little gift shop too. it was like being at disneyland. =P

EAjrWg5DmCesYSex4AHw4g.text: Being the only location in Arizona the Rainforest Cafe at the Arizona Mills Mall automatically earns itself a positive reputation. However, the restaurant's success and appeal are also a result of the restaurant's fun-oriented atmosphere as well as its individuality.  As mentioned earlier, Rainforest Cafe is located at the Arizona Mills Mall in Tempe, a large mall different from other malls in Arizona. There are plenty of things to do here because the mall is home to a Harkins IMAX movie theater and a Gameworks in addition to all of the stores. The assortment of available activities makes the mall a good place to plan an entire day of events. This is exactly what my girlfriend and I did for our one-year anniversary; we started off the day with a meal at the Rainforest Cafe, strolled around the mall for a while, and then saw a movie at the Harkins. All in all, it proved to be an entertaining day, and the highlight of it was our fun-filled visit to the Rainforest Cafe.  The setting of the Rainforest Cafe is similar to that of an amusement park rather than a regular restaurant, and is the main reason that people choose to visit here. The restaurant was designed to look like a tropical rainforest, and is filled with artificial trees, animatronic animals, and large aquariums filled with live fish. Fake fog and thunderstorms add to the wild vibe, and provide an entertaining environment different from other locales. Because of its similarity to amusement parks such as Disneyland, the Rainforest Cafe is popular among families and teenagers looking to have a good time. As a result, the restaurant is often filled with loud, energetic children, which can be annoying but also adds to the overall mood because their antics are similar to those of the electronic gorillas that periodically cause an uproar in their of the restaurant. Besides, since most of the people dining at the restaurant are there to have a good time, it does little to disturb their visit.  In terms of service, Rainforest Cafe is just average; they often appear rushed and a little confused, which is understandable because the restaurant is always so busy. However, they are always friendly and willing to help, making up for their overwhelmed service.  The only fault of the Rainforest Cafe is the pricing, which is a little excessive considering that the majority of the items are of common quality. But the prices are not so extreme that they take away from the restaurant's appeal because the unique experience offered by this location is worth paying a little extra.

KzB9izj2kcip9XHzx6jj7Q.text: cool place for kids.  keeps them occupied while waiting.....overpriced food and all the servers were walking around looking like depressed zookeepers!  poor service:(

PugVE5NJH7aJzBcUnAFD-Q.text: I ordered the Paella here and it was drenched in oil.  That dish sat in my belly and damn near immobilized me.  My kids like it in there.  My wallet doesn't.  All that stuff they've got going on in there is merely to distract you from the awful food they serve.

zJstA-RDPBTUFd4lZwnfFA.text: I have been here way too many times but I am officially done giving them chances. So frustrating that this place doesn't step it up! It is pretty much an overpriced bar. They have no healthy options on their kids menu and it's not much better on the regular menu. I consider this place a kid-friendly restaurant due to the atmosphere and concept. But the service is way too slow! The number one thing that I look for when bringing kids out to eat is fast service. It's no secret that kids have no patience for waiting 15+ minutes for a check. And happy kids equal happy customers. Crying and winy kids equal annoyed and unhappy customers. So speed it up at least please!

vhWnFditsdHjpfDfAlfS8w.text: Eh. This rainforest cafe has a lot to be desired. Came here while we were in town for the Super Bowl and wasn't impressed. Our server less then serviced us and the food seemed to take forever to come out and there was less then 5 tables taken in the place. 12t8RQKdWKuyEpe6sBfgzA.text: This is really a one star restaurant, but I gave two stars because of the atmosphere.   On our drive home from Las Vegas, we decided to stop in Tempe and treat our 5 year old to lunch at Rainforest Cafe, thinking he would really enjoy it. (Nope.)  The wait was about thirty minutes to get in. The line was all the way from the restaurant to the front of the store, even though half the tables were empty.  The menu was disappointing. The selection is thoroughly "meh" and the prices are astronomical. $14 for a mediocre burger? Imagine my surprise at experiencing sticker shock in Tempe after just coming from Las Vegas, land of overpriced food. I ordered a cheesesteak that turned out to be some hard bread stuffed with an overabundance of lettuce and tomatoes. I guess they were trying to make up for the lack of both cheese and steak. To make matters worse, the wait for our food seemed unreasonably long.  If you're coming here, chances are it's for the atmosphere and not the food. That's good, because the food is not. I've given this place enough chances. We will not be returning.

GMgnyXwri-s2yIW-FKRCTw.text: I went here with my brother and his family about 5 years ago when I was visiting from Denver. I now live in Phoenix and decided to take my family. The difference was stark. No fish in the fish tanks, half the animals were only partially working, and the fountain smelled of something terrible. It's amazing how quickly a location can go downhill when the owners skimp on proper maintenance. They need to recognize quickly that the sole reason people come to this place is all the things they're cutting in their budgets. If they want to be another Chilis or Applebees then they need to price accordingly. The current prices are extreme given that it is no longer a destination for anything other than food.

OeBPQt_eo4-wIKPOYEzrtw.text: Long wait for frozen food with high prices. Took my son for his birthday and mentioned it the way in. Zero acknowledgement of his special day. Will never go here again.

zfGyUC3HEsd-Ezh-m4hZWw.text: Headed here after seeing a movie at the Harkins located inside the same mall. We were interested in checking out the menu first since we weren't sure if this one had the same offerings we were used to from the Orlando location we went to from time to time.    After looking over the menu we decided that we could all find something we wanted to eat here and we were brought a few more menus after a bit. I ordered the Cobb Salad, he had the Turkey BLT Club and our friend had the Quesadilla. The Cobb Salad had a lot of toppings on it and it was well-made, but it was really covered in dressing to a point that it was all you tasted. If we ever go back, I'll definitely request that on the side.  The Club sandwich my husband had was sandwiched with bread that was toasted to a point it wasn't really edible, so he took everything out of it and at that, which kinda defeats the purpose of a sandwich altogether. The insides of the Club were fresh and tasty though and the fries that came with it were good as well.    Took awhile to get things from our waitress during almost every step of the meal. Which seemed a little odd considering we went during an off time and it wasn't too busy.  Overall: B- Probably wouldn't recommend it to people with all the other options in the food court just around the corner...but not a bad place if you are looking to entertain little ones.

Sandwiches would be okay if they were to cost half as much. The jungle thunderstorms and animated animals aren't worth this experience.

All of the food was excellent and full of flavor! The prices we're reasonable considering the atmosphere and entertainment provided. They also had waiters come to our table and sing happy birthday. We opted in for the "birthday package" which was full of great gifts. It included a memorable plate, canteen, binoculars , sunglasses, canopy hat etc. we all had a wonderful time and enjoyed our food it very much. We definitely will be back for another celebration! The team members were very positive and happy and the manager was wonderful! Great job!

C0W7Hne-dx9qHVOT5jjwcw.text: The food was just ok. It has a good atmosphere for the kids. A little loud but that's to be expected. Prices are high and servers are slow.

qZ5e98G4ldEKSO5mJMJADg.text: I've been here 3 times and have had great experiences each time. The food is fairly good and the service is excellent! The atmosphere is loud and fun; children love it!!! The aquariums are always fun to watch. This is a fun place to go for something out of the ordinary!

SmWK7iIQyuL7-yf1-vngcw.text: I came here with my family for a first time experience for our little ones. They seat us almost in the middle and close to the exit (no where close to the animals even though there were two tables close to the elephants and one by the monkeys). We were told that they waitress in that area was not willing to take more tables. So we got a crappy seat :(    Next: our waitress was nice and attentive and came by often to ask us about refills. But when I ask for a Long Island ice tea, I was told that she wasn't sure if they were going to be able to make it and if they did there would be an extra charge (not sure for what). When I got the drink the drink was water down and not tasty at all. She took it back and brought me a new one! Very nice of her but it's still nasty.   In general our food was good but very pricey and were charge for every single condiments that probably measure a tea spoon at max. The food was ok and the presentation of it was ok also. But I will most likely not comeback and spend $180 in dinner.

bUKySejAPMIUGytDm5ctBw.text: Came for the experience of a Rainforest Cafe, and I will not be returning. The service was awful. We waited an hour for our food to arrive and even considered leaving as we were so hungry. Despite the horrendous service, the food was actually quite good. I ordered the coastal redfish without sauce and with extra veggies instead of rice, and everything was delicious, especially the shrimp and pineapples that topped the fish, hence the second star.

HsEQaF7IuvXqwNe3hRsDTw.text: Just wow. I just moved to AZ from NC and went to the Mills to get some new work clothes. I had about an hour until I could get into my condo so I decided to have a cocktail. I walked up to the hostess, let her know I was going to sit at the bar, and took a stool about 3 seats down from one of the beer tap stations. I was the only person sitting at the bar. After about 5 minutes, the bartender appeared and started making drinks for customers in the dining area. He turned around and looked right at me no less than 3 times, but never came over. I eventually got up and left and let the hostess know that no one ever acknowledged me so I was leaving. She didn't seem to care very much.

-gm5RXhAFMK-DPCytaB8uw.text: I had a bad experience previously but I wanted to go back  to let me grandson see the animals and have the complete experience. It took 35 minutes to get the drinks we ordered. We had to order the kids meals separated to make sure he got his food. Then 1 hour 15 after that we got our food. (I used the timer on my phone). The waitress was horrible and occasionally stopped by rushing of without really listening. This is the second time this occurred so it wasn't just a one off thing, it seem to be status quo. She asked me about a Landry card and then took 25 minutes to check to see if I was registered. When she could not find the info under my name I said I would sign up because of the other restaurant like Claim Jumper, she forgot to let me know it was $25 to join and said "I just figured you knew since you thought you had a card before".  The food was horrible, the tomato soup had seeds in it, the Alfredo sauce was brown and the seafood was over cooked. The drinks were too sweet and we were charged a different amount than was listed on the menu. 1st time could have been a fluke, 2nd time proved this is how they operate and evidently it is acceptable since no manager attempted to check on us but to add the $25 for the Landry card. NEVER AGAIN!

VOOocH7JrSFkwlqpQ9Ftcg.text: We wanted our 2 kids to have an adventure, so we brought them to the Rainforset Cafe. When we arrived, I went to the loo, and my husband ordered water for all of us. When I got to the table, our waiter came and took our order. I asked for a club soda with lime, ordered a burger without the bun, and asked about the shrimp scampi for a side, because I have a wheat allergy. We also asked for more forks, as our daughter had dropped 2. He got everything down and left. Minutes later, a manager came over and asked about my allergy. I was happy that they took it seriously. He told me there was gluten in the scampi butter. He said they could give me grilled shrimp with melted butter on the side. That sounded good so I went with that. Then, we waited, and waited, and waited. After about 15 min, our waiter came and asked how we were doing. I said fine, but could I please have my club soda. He went and got it and apologized profusely. Then, we waited and waited and waited. It was about a 40 minute wait before our food arrived. We still didn't have any forks. We asked for forks, ketchup, and I asked for my melted butter. He left and returned with forks, ketchup, and a dollop of cold butter in a side dish. I told him it was supposed to be melted but I'd just make do. We also asked for more napkins which never came. Not once were we offered refills on our water or club soda. It was like he didn't even try. It just wasn't worth it. We won't be eating there again.

dTLrCdps6uZ1OBSESyb6Xw.text: We found tbis place from a flyer at our resort stay thought we would check it out.  The atmosphere was ok, rainforest and all.  But, with all the help they had, it took way to long to get served, I counted 15 servers, 4 managers and 4 hostice , yet it took 45 minutes to get served. portions were good size, prices were a bit high.  Didn't think it was worth the price.  when it takes 20 minutes to just get a drinks, something is wrong.  wasn't that busy for it to take so long to get served.

6ZqqKX0opiDZ5A_NEzWHdw.text: Great ambience and a fun place to go for young kids. As long as you're not too young.  Toddlers tend to get freaked out by the fake thunder and lightning. Five year and older really enjoy it.  Service is good and the food is OK. It is little pricey but considering your paying for the special effects it's understandable.

dK6tHWiuv30I_41dqI633Q.text: When we went last week, the women's bathroom was dirty and needed maintenance. Besides ourselves, there was only one other family being served. It took more than half an hour to receive our food. My order included a steak which was made well done when I asked for medium well. Also, I had to ask for a steak knife, since I wasn't given one with my steak. Overall, we received disappointing service.

RL4__VGJnZQyb--Izu1Xng.text: I went here last night with 5 others, and I am sadly disappointed.  5 of us had cold to luke-warm food served.  I ordered the "Taste of the Islands" and the "blackened tilapia" was not blackened and was room temp.  My mashed potatoes were room temp and not very soft.  The scallops were hot-ish, and the shrimp which came late was not all that hot.      The way overpriced menu is apparently for the environment, which is falling apart.  The huge fish tank is now fishless, which also took away from the environment.       I would not recommend this place at all.  If you're hungry, go to the food court, you'll get better quality and most likely hot food.

gVNQrzspOXWlnDcn4N1HWA.text: Kids loved seeing all the animals super fun for kids. Friendly service took a while for food to show up.  I would go back.

sRvhpKHouYIi8Uw869Mrjg.text: Really average food for a ridiculous price. Describes every Rainforest Cafe I've been to and I can't wait until my children are old enough not to be lured in by the elephants and gorillas. Soup and salad were okay. Burger was okay. Service was average.

SWE3-FKlArp8vRVIhJlH2w.text: Horrible service and way too long for food of that quality. Ambiance wore off as we waited forever for our food.

9nfZqkyOvLRUquk-2Y_R-Q.text: I was excited to try this place out for the first time. I went with my friend and her daughter. After being seated we looked around and were enjoying the scenery. The rain forest vibe was awesome. The fake storms and animal noises were unique for a dining experience. The scenery is the only reason I gave this review a star.  We looked at the menu and it seemed a little pricey but I did not care because I was hungry and figured I was paying for the environment. We waited....waited.....and waited. No one came by to take our order or offer us drinks. After 30 minutes of sitting there without any service, we left and went to another place in the mall to eat.   Sadly, after reading the other reviews I see that there are many problems other than what we encountered. I don't think I will return until whoever runs this establishment learns how to manage and run a restaurant effectively.

QeOe9HIrwaX3Cxhc8-UsFQ.text: We had a great meal and I was very impressed by the service!  If we go again, I need to ask to be seated a bit away from the "animals"; they were too loud for me.

mkYQVgKeMRijyAqjJwKRSQ.text: I haven't been to this place since I was a kid and I figured the food would be basic at best but it was delicious! Everyone at my table enjoyed their meal and the service was excellent! I would would recommend it to anyone especially if you have loud kids but want to enjoy a gourmet meal.

_eEVEZd_yktb6AHyt4rvQQ.text: The atmosphere is pretty loud. It's a cute little rainforest theme with animatronic elephants and gorillas that periodically come to life. Most kids at the few tables there liked it. My daughter wasn't scared at all until this kid about her age started freaking out at the next table.   The food is decent for adults. Amazing? No.   My little one had the kids pizza. It looked like some crappy frozen pizza stuck on a cafeteria plate with broccoli and orange slices. The cheese on the pizza had coagulated into a tepid cardboard like triangle with pepperoni on it. She only liked the steamed broccoli and oranges. -I'm sure they don't try to serve piping hot pizza to kids in the event their parent is irresponsible and the kid burns themselves, but my kiddo doesn't like almost cold pizza  I had a combination plate. It's not pretty like the picture. I was super hungry so I didn't take a picture of it. It looks less appetizing. But, it's not terrible. I liked the bacon wrapped shrimp with jalapenos. Those were pretty delicious. I'd eat that again. There was a white fish topped with mango salsa. I can't remember the type of fish, probably tilapia. It was not really great or worth remembering. The temperature was weird, probably because it was sitting too long before being brought out so the cold mango salsa had time to cool the about 3/4" thick piece of fish almost all the way through, so it was lukewarm on the part that touched the grill plate. There was also a salsa topped chicken and grilled veggies. I loved the grilled veggies. I'm a huge fan of perfectly seasoned & grilled zucchini. The chicken was cooked well, which is definitely good. I asked for no cheese on the chicken, with which they complied.   Overall, if it wasn't as expensive, and service was better, I'd be more inclined to go back. It wasn't the worst service ever, but I had time to box up 2 meals and stand up and wait with my kiddo while about 5-7 servers were averting their eyes and dodging my table so no one would feel "obligated" to run my card so I could hurry and leave. I think I had to wait about 10 minutes for him to come back and get my card when he could have waited less than 15 seconds for me to put my card in and take the tab. The place was not busy, either. If the tables were full, it would have been different. If you're not in any rush, it's really not a bad place to eat at.

NPgpb-0VIqhkGiyG2YxP4A.text: I don't see why they would have a full bar when this is really more of the children typesetting, very high-priced small selection of food.

lfxK1TpOUZslxQmfLZ9xtQ.text: My wife and I had not been to rainforest in many years, and always loved it when we came before.  We were seated quickly, had very friendly service.   We ordered off of their 'special menu'. The food was very so so. The coconut shrimp was great, however the steak and veggies looked like they were from dennys.  And had I paid $9.99 I would have been happy, however it was closer to $27.   I guess we'll wait another 10 years and give it another shot.

FDKNg1L-mBBNmaooBLZ29A.text: Our experience this afternoon was so disappointing that I'm going to actually call corporate after I write this review. I've never had bad experiences at the Downtown Disney and Las Vegas locations. This location back in the 90s was actually pretty great. The start of our experience was great, our server got and drinks and apps out in good time. After we placed our food order things went down hill fast.  We had been waiting for our food for over an hour and the restaurant didn't have every single table full of people, we were actually surrounded by a bunch of empty tables. When we could finally track down our ever-absent waitress we asked her to cancel our food order and we just wanted to pay the remainder of our bill so that we could go somewhere else. Our request prompted the manager to come over and apologize. I told her we were out for our sister's birthday and wanted to have a good time but we were so disappointed in the wait and lack of service. She offered to take 50% off our bill and still bring us our food but we just wanted the bill so we could leave. I get the bill about 10-15 minutes later and all she took off was the food, no additional discount was on the bill. I was so fed up with the situation I didn't even care . The prices are insanely high at a place like this but you go for the experience and the fun atmosphere....well I paid a stupid price for some appetizers and a cruddy experience.

ZtTcqyN1uwIbML8jOPhENQ.text: I'm a glutton for punishment,  there's only 2 servers on.  So long long wait buy at least manager is helping run food.

ILDL91TafmKLgtrux1bvuw.text: I want to love this place. The service was fantastic, which is always a plus.  The atmosphere is awesome, and they seated us right next to the gorillas, which my kids of course just loved.   You are paying for the experience, so you really can't complain about the price of the meals.  But... if you are paying for the experience... they could try to keep some actual fish in the fish tanks. All of the fish tanks were empty, which was really weird.  They had water in them, but we looked, and there were no actual fish. (Unless they were ALL hiding, but that seems unlikely).   A few other things:  The kids menu has "fruit" as an option, but in Arizona in the summer, that's just orange slices. I kind of feel like they could do better or list orange slices as a specific option. I ordered the nachos, and I asked them to do real shredded cheese instead of cheese sauce. This doesn't seem like an odd request to me, but the person who made them must have never actually eaten nachos before, because they were SO covered in cheese, and the cheese was so overcooked, it was like eating rubber cheese with chips stuck in it. Really weird. Hard to pull the chips out of the cheese layer and kind of hard to eat. And strangely greasy, especially since I ordered them without meat.  Should be served with a side of salsa, but they aren't -- just the pico de gallo that is on them, which is chunky, not saucy.   I will come back, but only because my kids don't really care about the mediocre food. They think it's a fun place to be.

LOXrcjaltaJnKUaNXfKiUQ.text: I went here for my daughters 3rd birthday. She loved it! The food was very good and reasonably priced considering the atmosphere. I would highly recommend this place for a kids birthday party. I had the pasta bolognese and it was excellent.

Her attitude was of a ooh well response.  Our sever was prompt and was helpful. Our mozzarella sticks were awesome its been 40 minutes and no burger or sandwich wow.    Finally the food arrives looks good fries crisp burger cold wifes philly is ok. WZQBXRxRfEUWN_rLOXc-Rw.text: The experience here could have been better. First of all we were waiting in line for 40 min, but there were plenty of seating. Second, when we got seated we were right by the restrooms and away from most of the nice rainforest views. Even though there were many open spots. The food was great and our waiter was kind, but she was trying to rush us out. She never refilled our drinks and gave us our receipt without asking if we wanted dessert. Then when we asked for dessert she brought it to us in a to go box. That was just rude, who wants to take ice cream home especially when you live 40 minutes away?? I want to bring my young siblings here but starting to reconsider due to the poor service.

OBb4SKk3atnlz78M0Bn8Dw.text: Neat place to take kids for the atmosphere. But...it's really over priced for the quality if food and the amount of time the food took to come out. Food was bland and my pasta was cold by the time it got to the table. Service was ok I guess.

pUJEeY7CKQmHSfbGV99Dog.text: Consider the destination on its own. As far as food goes, it's decent. Service about average.

v-ZPwParBV2tx6sqFMSEJw.text: The atmosphere is beautiful and of course loud but hey go sit by a real waterfall in a real Rainforest...it is going to be loud. xD  The service is a little slow but from previous experience in the restaurant business I want to guess it is the kitchen. However the servers are very polite and I have noticed that they do work together to help out each other.   Some of the food is good and some of it needs salt or some type of flavor. I would suggest the chicken salad sandwich, any of the appetizers,  the guacamole burger, and Caribbean coconut shrimp. Oh! They also got a new item on the menu which is really surprising and good, the "Ozzie Omelet." Loved it!  The gift shop is full of cool stuff! I always see new items when I go which is awesome.  There is also an employee always greeting people walking in which is nice but can sometimes be annoying.   The bathroom is a bit small but still fits the rainforest theme. Sometimes it is really dirty but I do not understand how people leave paper towels on the sink...there is a trash can in the bathroom.   Overall love this place and it is way better then the one in Vegas! :)

Yes it looks fun, yes it's great atmosphere, yes there's much to see, yes...yes... yes...  now! food-wise... I was amazed to have good food. I had Chicken Alfredo and It was just right! huge portion and what kick it up a notch was the HOT ROSEMARY FOCACIA BREAD!   we all won! kids had fun and mom had good food. NbCiYebDlvGa1gdzF8eFxA.text: Expensive. This place is ridiculously expensive. Horrible. There are more spoiled little kids running around then chuckee cheese, service was not good and took forever on a slow afternoon. Food was seriously lacking flavor. They don't have prices marked for their booze so I ordered a beer that came to be in a 12oz bottle and was charged $5. But if you go here with a 2 person party and get the cheapest burgers on the menu, you are basically paying almost $50 to stare at fish and robotic elephants. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. I regret everything about this place.

SWoXDO2LAsVsKDPr50P-xA.text: Drinks were really weak, food took forever to get here, wasnt even that busy, kids runnin around everywhere. Unclean dishes.... Never coming back...  For a touristy place I guess I should of expected this, but for the prices they were asking for... I expected better.

hwxMbKtJ_RaTj-SWlCyCyg.text: This is a great place to take children.  Large aquariums stocked with big colorful fish are everywhere. A really big fountain inside the restaurant adds to the ambiance as does all the moving animal displays and the whole feeling of being inside of an actual rainforest.  There are even thunder and lightning along with shooting stars.  The food is good enough and the service is adequate.

ulbMY_HRIXZyBSoYWrvJCw.text: I found the Rainforest Store to be very disappointing. I went in there with one goal: buy a mechanical parrot. Man, they make the mechanized parrot purchasing experience a nightmare.   Aside from the fact that the roof leaks and you're constantly in danger of being electrocuted, none of the staff seem at all versed in the features or options of the parrots. Are the roosts sold separately? How much for the whole tree? Can my parrot be "taught" new bawdy phrases to delight my friends?   And when you press them on the issue, they try to divert your attention away from your seemingly simple mission by plying you with alcohol and the shittiest microwaved snacks you can imagine. I mean, it seems like a nice gesture to give you something to nibble on while you wait for a Senior Parrot Specialist to come to your assistance and close the sale; but in the end you just end up wet, hammered, food poisoned and parrotless.  [ UPDATE: When checking my online banking later, I noticed they charged me for the food and drinks! I thought it was complimentary and they just wanted my credit card to put down a deposit on my birdie. What a racket. ]

LQ9fCeT7fjnUkl78MVcmHQ.text: I knew I didn't want to eat there when my family said they wanted to... Took forever to get our meal and 2 of us ordered medium rare.  when they came out the were well ,,, told the Mgr and he didnt to a thing about it,,, Fries were cold

AZ2BN3yvgiIqDdcXum2yaw.text: Overpriced for what it is. The atmosphere is great, which is why it still gets three stars. The food is so-so at best.

FT3W_4pzW1d4sjkCbSkWJg.text: I would give it less if I could. I have been here once before about 6 or 7 years ago. At that time I thought I wouldn't be back, it was dirty and smelt weird and the food wasn't good. Well a long time has passed and we went for a friends birthday. We ordered apps and waited for a while for those. They where decent not great but decent. Next comes the food. The waiter sets the food in front of me and on my plate of chicken parm there is a plastic bag with pasta and sauce in it. The bag is marked Sunday and it was Wednesday. I looked at it, laughed a little to myself then pointed it out to the rest of the table. We flagged down the waiter and showed him the plate. He took it back grumbled something and walked away with it. Came back out 2 minutes later with the pasta dumped out of the bag onto my plate. Being it was my friends birthday I didn't want to complain too much so I ate some of my chicken and didn't touch the pasta (in hind sight I shouldn't have eaten anything). My husband wasn't happy with what happened and flagged down the waiter on my behalf to ask him how old the pasta was. We wanted to know if it was good until Sunday or was it made on Sunday and are now serving it on Wednesday. The waiter started talking about him being and pharmacy tech or something like that and didn't answer the question. So my husband asked to talk to the manager. The Manager comes back to the table about 15 minutes after we asked to talk to him and after everyone else is done eating. He came up defensive and making excuses about company policy. They make pasta 2 times a week and portion it in little bags add sauce and microwave. It isn't like I expect to have great fresh food at a place like Rainforest Cafe but pasta 4 days old? It isn't like it is hard to cook or takes a long time. Needless to say I will never ever go to the restaurant again. I am glad what I did eat didn't make me sick. After my experience I checked the board of health sight and it is scary!! maricopa.gov/envsvc/envw... Think twice before going to this place.

ITv3oTQCtCGxeNq4OgK8lw.text: Hadn't been to this place since it first opened years ago, but decided to have lunch after a movie with my teens. After an initial sticker shock from the menu prices we decided to get appetizers only.  They were tasty, but still over 30 dollars for food that did not fill us up.  We should have just hit the food court.

ipd7cpTISqqfoLp6ih7VXw.text: The service by Cory was excellent.. But my burger was less than appetizing.  I asked for medium but received well done and the quality of meat was worse than McDonalds. Shame on you Rain Forrest Cafe.. The cost if the burger was $13. Oh and the nachos were rushed and all of the toppings were on one side.. Who uses processed cheese anymore? Everything was over priced for the quality of food.. I would not recommend this restaurant.

H5yr2mivEyklFUTZWO8iLQ.text: The restaurant was very empty and we were seated immediately.  That is when the problems began.  It took 25 minutes for someone to acknowledge us and the person who took the drink orders brought our kids (3 & 5) their drinks in adult cups.  The server finally made an appearance, acknowledged the long wait and said she would send a manager over.  This never happened.  She took our order and then we had to wait anther 25 minutes for the food to come out.  When the server said the food would be out in a minute and I asked what was taking so long to cook it, she snapped at me stating that she just told me that it would be right out.  My wife's Asian Shrimp Salad was soggy and the shrimp were cold, as if it had been sitting for some time.  My meal, the Ribs Steak Shrimp Trio was OK except for the issue that the steak was cooed to barely medium when I asked for medium well...25 minutes for a medium rarish steak?  The manager was apologetic and took my meal off the bill.  He then offered several times sundaes to the kids.  I was angry we still had to pay for this meal at all given the issues.  This is not the first time we have had these issues at this restaurant.  Although the kids love it, we have explained to them that we will no longer be going to this restaurant.

X0ewCtY4My_5DE1IgKOOng.text: Don't go here for the food or service. Food is outrageously expensive, small portions, no seasoning. You don't have to actually eat in the restaurant to see all the attractions. If you have kids, take them here, walk them around and then leave and go eat somewhere else. $68 for 2 adults and 2 kids (no drinks or dessert and one less expensive kids meal) is crazy.  My fish tacos had one tiny piece of fish and tons of cabbage.  Bland, bland, bland.  Will never eat here again.

FeKjHX8wWLAEyq-QJ847AA.text: I had never been to Rainforest Cafe and I'm glad that I got to try it because I love trying things at least once; however, this will also be my last time going there. We'll start from the beginning:   The atmosphere was nice for the "jungle" but it was so loud that I could not hear my wife talking to me. I felt that I had to scream at her to talk. Our waitress was nice but didn't check on us often. We barely understood her either because she speak loud enough. We got our drinks (ten mins later) and my iced tea was good but my wife's chocolate shake was gross. Too much chocolate syrup and it was expensive!! We sent it back so she could get water another 10 mins later. Food delivery was quick and my burger was pretty good but it was plain and $12!! Jeez, so expensive for something so plain!!! I got onion rings for an extra few dollars (they were okay but worth the extra few $$$). My wife got an extra plate of fries and they were a few bucks but they didn't give her more than ten! I like the atmosphere of the restaurant and the theme but they are completely over priced!!!! Not worth it at all! The food was mediocre but left me sick that night.   Not as amazing as I thought it would be after seeing it many times in Vegas...

PA6n2_2NTn9iWkLaxBvHZg.text: I have been to the Rainforest Cafe quite a few times and also in Florida.  The food was always pretty good, a bit pricey but good.  The atmosphere is very noisy, but thats a given.  Very kid friendly.  My husband, 10 month old and myself went there yesterday and our food really wasn't that great.  We were greeted nicely and seated pretty quickly, however, we waited for some time before we were finally approached by our server and asked what we wanted to drink. We started with the chili con queso dip and it wasn't anything special, it was good, but it could have used some sprucing up on the flavor. I ordered my little one the pasta with marinara and applesauce and my husband and I ordered the chicken marinara. We waited a long time for our food!  First of all let me say the portion for the child pasta was huge!!! Even for an older child!!! I could have eaten it myself and been full!!  The pasta was cooked al dente, which honestly I didn't expect, most places over cook the pasta which is good for my daughter as she doesn't have any back teeth yet.  I gave her two very small bites then had to return it for a grilled cheese because she kept gagging on the pieces since she couldn't chew them with the pasta being to al dente.  The waitress accommodated and even took the pasta off the check, yay!!   The grilled cheese took forever to come out, I was questioning how long does it take to make a grilled cheese, be it was good, I tried it myself ;)  Our food was ok.  The chicken was cooked perfectly but had way to much cheese melted on top for my liking.  There were two chicken breasts on the plate, pretty good size, for sure over the recommended daily protein intake.  There was a small portion of pasta also.  The sauce was kinda blah, tasted a little like jarred sauce and pretty garlicky..and thats saying something because I love garlic!!  Our bill was $70.00 with tip and all we ordered were our meals, two drinks, the appetizer and kids meal!!! Way too pricey for low to mediocre food.  My daughter really seemed to enjoy the atmosphere and loved the opportunity to be loud, but I don't think we will be back anytime soon.

Wv47cdt62us7FEvr2wvy5w.text: All I can say about this place is save your money!!! If you are looking for ambiance and terrible food, this is the place.  I have waited a long time to try a Rainforest Cafe and I was really disappointed!  The food around us did not look appealing so we ordered the appetizer platter.  The artichoke spinach dip was so thick and overcooked that the chips kept breaking.  The mozzarella sticks were overcooked and the cheese was rubbery. The chicken egg roll things were awful and had some kind of funky sauce. The chicken tenders were probably the most edible thing on the plate.  I still think for $15.99 this appetizer plater was not a deal!  We had also called and made a reservation for a booth by the waterfall and of course when we got there there were no booths left! So don't waste your time with reservations!  I really would like to say something nice about the place but between the food and service, I won't be back!!

Rk_26Sh66JsLiV7UPoekHQ.text: This is probably my third time eating here, and it will be my last. Service was less than stellar everytime before this time, but we thought we would give it another shot because the concept of the restaurant out daughter enjoys. We were seated and waited 10 minutes before we were asked about ordering drinks, but it was at this time we also ordered an appetizer for our table. We waited, and waited for our appetizer. We noticed that two tables down from us they received the same appetizer that we had ordered, and it sat on their table for about 10 minutes before the waitress came back and let her know that they did not order the nachos. So back to the kitchen they go, in the meantime, out waitress goes back to check on our apps. About 5 minutes later, out comes a manager with a plate of ice cold nachos, which one has to assume probably came from the other table. We pointed this out to him, he took off to check on getting more, in the meantime we decided to leave. While were gathering our things, our meal showed up, but still no appetizer. No thanks guys, we will go elsewhere! To top or off, they didn't even comp our sodas or apologize for anything. I will never step foot in their again! All of these bad reviews are right on! Poor service and management!! Don't waste your time or money!

3AdrMOL-hGQL8OAYZsvKkA.text: Food was decent, as was staff. Nothing really noteworthy. Same as every other rainforest cafe.

_k72jGquFJR8KxrIIL7XOg.text: Really neat scene for a resteraunt but everything is is separate on the menu so fries will cost you extra with the very expensive on tray.  Foods so so but not worth what you pay for it.

XFn7XwLMId-70AFBjElLKw.text: Overpriced food and mediocre service.  My son had the kids pizza and barely touched it as it didn't taste good  (. 99 cent pizza inflated to $6.00).  I paid in cash including tip.  When I asked for a copy of receipt after paying turns out they took off the $6,  but waitress decided to keep that for herself

hDoqBoHESN3BfWRLr1PJgg.text: I have two kiddies and they love this place. I however, am not as excited about it as they are. The food was so-so and still more expensive than I would've liked. There's all sorts of "kid traps". Light-up glasses and an entire gift shop full of more over-priced items. On the plus side, there's a mechanical crocodile just outside the restaurant. If your kid is young enough, you can always use that crocodile as collateral . . . . . "If you don't finish your food, that crocodile will get mad". "If you don't behave that crocodile is going to come over". You know, things like that which we may or may not have said to our son. - insert evil grin here-

bxOBSKoTXrRBM3EehTjSUg.text: Its a great place to take the kids, as the environment is very stimulating.  Although I was not too impressed with the selection of foods on the menu.  The seasoning of the food was "exotic", lots of lime and citrus-e- taste ( i guess that would be appropriate given the "rain forest" name ).  It has became a place for my family to go and enjoy a dessert and watch the animal show and the aquariums.  Beware of the enticing gift shop.

6EzPiw2VuRRM1zdtsMP_5Q.text: This place would be cool if I was really into mechanical animals. Or five years old.  The Rainforest Cafe is just a little overpriced in my opinion and it's a themed restaurant filled with little animals that move every few minutes while you eat.  I think you hear thunder and rain and mist falls on diners every now and then.  For kids, this place would be great.  Especially for birthday parties- I'd definitely plan a bash here if I had kids.  But I don't, so I won't be going back to the Rainforest cafe with their animated gorillas and mysterious smog anytime soon.

K6Lcz5v7IT4GOBemrWXY6Q.text: This place was a laugh!.....in a good way.....we had just ordered when a simulated lighting storm occurred....the lights were flashing, thunder was booming and all of the animatronics were screeching......We just had to try this place as I had never experienced anything like this in Australia....the restaurant came complete with a night sky with twinkling stars, a fog machine around the bar, huge tropical fish tanks and bar stools in the shape of animal rears and feet!.....Our waitress was great.....and the food was good.....we did not expect 5 star dining as clearly this is the last place you would go if you were feeling 5 star....it is essentially for children but we had fun as we still have a lot of child in us. My husband had the coconut shrimp which was actually very good and I had the English style fish and chips which I have to say was not very English but the fish was very tasty. Great for a casual bite and to entertain the children......not sure if you want to take very young young children here though as it can get quite noisy and some of the very young ones looked quite concerned!
